> Be careful out there - Deb
>
>
> In light of the recent abduction of Dru Shodin 
of Minnesota, I hope
> you don't mind my sending you this email with 
tips about how to
> avoid abduction.  Feel free to share it with 
your staff, friends,
> and family.  I received this from someone at 
DHS.  I called the
> doctor's office after I received it to make 
sure it was truly
> compiled by her (the original email stated it 
wasn't certain) and
> that it was okay to share it with her name 
referenced.  She
> encourages everyone to share with all your 
friends.
>
> Abigail
> _____________________
>
> These "Safety Tips to Avoid Abduction" were 
compiled by:
>
> Dr. Anabel de Juan Gomez, Staffing Specialist
> St. Paul Public School System
> 360 Colborne Street
> St. Paul, MN 55108
> Tel. 651-767-8196
> Fax 651-665-0269
>
> Safety Tips to Avoid Abduction
>
> 1. Tip from Tae Kwon Do: The elbow is the 
strongest point on your
> body. If you are close enough to use it, do!
>
> 2. From a tourist guide in New Orleans: If a 
robber asks for your
> wallet and/or purse, DO NOT HAND IT TO HIM. 
Toss it away from
> you--chances are that he is more interested in 
your wallet and/or
> purse than you, and he will go for the 
wallet/purse.
>
> 3. If you are ever thrown into the trunk of a 
car: Kick out the
> back tail-lights, stick your arm out the hole, 
and start waving like
> crazy. The driver won't see you but everybody 
else will. This has
> saved lives.
>
> 4. Women have a tendency to get into their cars

after shopping,
> eating, working, etc., and just sit doing their

checkbook, making a
> list, etc.  DON'T DO THIS! The predator will be

watching you, and
> this is the perfect opportunity for him to get 
in on the passenger
> side, put a gun to your head, and tell you 
where to go. AS SOON AS
> YOU GET INTO YOUR CAR, LOCK THE DOORS AND 
LEAVE.
>
> 5. A few notes about getting into your car in a

parking lot, or
> parking garage:
>     a.  Be aware.  Look around you, look into 
your car, at the
> passenger side floor, and in the back seat.
>     b.  If you are parked next to a big van, 
enter your car from
> the passenger door. Most serial killers attack 
their victims by
> pulling them into their vans while the women 
are attempting to get
> into their cars.
>     c.  Look at the car parked on the driver's 
side of your
> vehicle, and on the passenger side. If a male 
is sitting alone in
> the seat nearest your car, you may want to walk

back into the mall,
> or work, and get a guard/policeman to walk you 
back out. IT IS
> ALWAYS BETTER TO BE SAFE THAN SORRY, and better

paranoid than dead.
>
>
> 6.  ALWAYS take the elevator instead of the 
stairs.  Stairwells are
> horrible places to be alone and the perfect 
crime spot.
>
> 7.   If the predator has a gun and you are not 
under his control,
> ALWAYS RUN! The predator will only hit you (a 
running target) 4 in
> 100 times, and even then, it most likely WILL 
NOT be a vital organ.
> RUN!
>
> 8.   As women, we are always trying to be 
sympathetic. STOP IT! It
> may get you raped, or killed. Ted Bundy, the 
serial killer, was a
> good-looking, well educated man, who ALWAYS 
played on the sympathies
> of unsuspecting women. He walked with a cane, 
or a limp, and often
> asked "for help" into his vehicle or with his 
vehicle, which is when
> he abducted his next victim.
>
> Another Safety Point: Crying Baby
> A woman heard a crying baby on her porch one 
night, and she called
> the police because it was late and she thought 
it was weird. The
> police told her "Whatever you do, DO NOT open 
the door." The lady
> then said that it sounded like the baby had 
crawled near a window,
> and she was worried that it would crawl to the 
street and get run
> over. The policeman  said, "We already have a 
unit on the way,
> whatever you do, DO NOT open the door." He told

her that they
> thought a serial killer had a baby's cry 
recorded and uses it to
> coax women out of their homes thinking that 
someone dropped off a
> baby. He said they have not verified it, but 
have had several calls
> by women saying that they hear baby's cries 
outside their doors when
> they're home alone at night.  Please pass this 
on! and DO NOT open
> the door for a crying baby.... This e-mail 
should probably be taken
> seriously because the Crying Baby theory was 
mentioned on America's
> Most Wanted when they profiled a serial killer 
in Louisiana.
>
> I'd like you to forward this to all the women 
you know. It may save
> a life.  A candle is not dimmed by lighting 
another candle. I was
> going to send this to the ladies only, but 
guys, if you love your
> mothers, wives, sisters, daughters, etc., you 
may want to pass it
> onto them, as well. Send this to any woman you 
know that may need to
> be reminded that the world we live in has a lot

of crazies in
> it.....and it's better safe than sorry.
>
> Dr. Anabel de Juan Gomez, Staffing Specialist
> St. Paul Public School System

the
essense the vibe the spirituality all accumilating growing growing growing
throughout the populance of the world, which could eventually have potential 
to
overthrow the establishment and create a new utopian world (new age of 
aquarious
type of deal) most ravers tho would argue that raves are supposed to be
underground and they're supposed to take u away from the worlds proplems not 
fight
against them as   a "movement". Anyways when i brought this idea up to my 
friend
(the christian) he was disgusted by it. the thought of raves accumilating
massively throughout the world, because to him, this was discribed in the 
bible
like in revelations or what not. it was said that nations would unite under 
a
false prophecy, and this would be a sign of the anti-christ. the drugs the
orgies the false sense of utopia, we were supposedly warned of all of this 
and
we're supposed to know it means the end is near. me i don't buy it, it sure 
as
hell interests me because it's so intense, i'd like to study it more or have 
some
of ya'll sfr's enlighten me if u have knowledge on this topic.... but if i
were inclined to believe anything as of now, i'd say that christ was 
manifested
in the spirit of raving because it's like setting people free. to say that 
god
was disgusted by raves, sounds like a hidden agenda to me...

Subject: Re: [sfraves]Technics: How would you ship them?

I've owned a few pair of 1200s since I learned to spin when I was 15.  I sold 
the first pair before I left for boot camp.

I took my last pair with me on the plane.  I took one of them as a carry on, 
and the other was inside a softsided luggage surrounded by clothes.  They BOTH 
were contained inside airline approved hard cases.  These are heavy but they 
protect the turntables.

The time before this last move, I took one on as a carry on inside the flight 
case, and a friend brought the other one over with her when she came on a later 
flight.

Frank

> >
> > > heya
> > >
> > > I've shipped like civic parts n stuff to japan and dealt with australia,
> > > canada, europe. . .
> > > You can do the stuff online att like www.ups.com or www.usps.com
> > >
> > > overseas shipments cost almost twice the price with UPS rather than USPS
> > > since it has to be 2 nd day air or faster
> > >
> > > usps to japan for about 50 or so pound was like $71, and he recieved it 
> >in
> > > around 2 weeks. .  .
> > > UPS was $186. ..
> > >
> > > To pack em,
> > > first I'd get some good bubblewrap and a good box that fit both of em,
> > > level, sort of on top of eachother.Put both tables in some type of 
> >plastic
> > > bag for dust n such, then wrap both tables (with covers I assume, put 
> >the
> > > carts in their cases or something, and secure everything) in the bubble
> >wrap
> > > covering all sides. Then padd the bottom of the box a lil and drop it 
> >in.
> > > Put some more bubble wrap on top of that and then use a square sheet of
> > > cardboard the same size as the box (lXw). . .on that, make sure the 
> >table
> > > fits snug yknow. . .add some packing something or other to take up the
> > > space. . .
> > > So with the other table, put a lil bubbleshit on the carboard sheet. . .
> >and
> > > drop the other table in. . . pack as necessary. . . if you have ortofons
> >or
> > > something just put them in the cases and somewhere in the box. . . pack 
> >it
> > > really tight, like so you shake the box and nothing moves. . .
> > >
> > > then tape the hell out of it, but not so as to attract suspicion of
> > > terrorism or anything like that. . .
> > >
> > > Theres a company, THARCO, that makes "corrugated shipping containers". 
> >Its
> > > like a couple blocks from where I live.I cant find their catalog but 
> >just
> > > call 411 and get their number. It's in San Lorenzo. They're open 24hrs,
> >and
> > > accept small orders of just a couple boxes to bundles. . . if you want a
> > > really strong box use the doublewall ones they have.
> > > figure,
> > > a single Technic, is what , like
> > >
> > >   a.. Width: 17-13/16"
> > >   b.. Height: 6-5/8"
> > >   c.. Depth: 14-1/4"
> > >   d.. Weight: 26.4 lbs
> > > So get one box thats like 22x18x18, and a sheet of semi-thick 22x18" 
> >sheet
> > > of cardboard. . .
> > > guess like total weight of around 54lbs. . .
> > > the cardboard will cost like $3-4, n all sorts of places have bubblewrap
> >and
> > > tharco prolly also has all sorts of packing materials. . .
> > >
> > > you can get shipping quotes on both the ups and usps website.

> >have
> > > to fill out all sorts of forms n such. . . you can prolly do it all for

Subject: [sfraves] Hearing on Youth Entertainment Crisis 

--=====================_1188228==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



WHAT:  Call for Action!

WHERE:  City Hall, Room 250

WHEN:  Thursday, January 15th, 5 pm

WHY:  San Francisco has few entertainment options for youth under 21

Hello!


My name is Liam Shy and I am the Youth Action Coordinator for the SFLNC.  I 
am also on the San Francisco Youth Commission, a city commission designed 
to advise the Mayor and Board of Supervisors on youth related issues in San 
Francisco.

I am 19 years old and a DJ.  When my favorite producers come to San 
Francisco, they only play in 21+ clubs.  Why?  Because there are almost no 
18+ entertainment venues in San Francisco and the few that exist have to 
close at 2 am.  Other major US cities, such as  New York, Los Angeles, and 
Seattle all allow 18+ parties to go past 2 am.

Last year, Mark Leno introduced legislation sponsored by the SFLNC to allow 
18+ entertainment events to go after-hours.  The legislation was passed by 
the Board of Supervisors but was then vetoed by then Mayor Willie

Brown.  This year the Youth Commission has made passage of this legislation 
one of its top priorities and we have worked with the SFLNC and Supervisor 
Bevan Dufty to produce a new draft of legislation to allow for 18+ 
after-hours events.

In December, the Youth Commission passed a resolution declaring San 
Francisco in a "public health crisis" over the lack of safe recreation and 
entertainment options for youth under 21.  As we all know, fun and safe 
recreational spaces help to keep youth out of trouble .  The serious 
deficiency that exists in San Francisco negatively impacts the mental and 
physical health of our youth, especially youth in at-risk communities.

There is already a serious deficiency in fun programming for young 
adults.  This will only get worse if proposed cuts in the Recreation and 
Parks Department budget become a reality.  In fact, the only youth led late 
night program, a City sponsored Hip-Hop dance party called Park Sessions, 
has already been put on hold.  If we don't stop the disproportionate cuts 
to Rec and Parks, hope of bringing back Park Sessions or creating new 
programs will be lost.

This hearing will be a chance for us to show City Hall how important 
recreation and entertainment is for youth!  Everyone is encouraged to 
attend and speak out on their vision for youth recreation and entertainment 
in San Francisco.

"We are the voice of the future, but that doesn't mean we can't change the 
present!" -Youth Commission Rec
and Services Committee

Liam Shy
Media and Public Relations Officer, SF Youth Commission
Youth Action Coordinator, SFLNC
<http://us.f108.mail.yahoo.com/ym/Compose?To=liamshy@sflnc.com>liamshy@sflnc.com



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: An Epiphany Of Sound tomorrow

Progressive is the word of the week.  (So I guess I'll also have to
point people of the other progressive persuasion to these tribes on
tribe.net: http://bushisthefakepresident.tribe.net,
http://secularhumanism.tribe.net).  Anyway, keeping with the word of the
week I'll be hosting DJs Jack Triumph and Illiaster for two hours (yeah,
a shorter show this quarter) of assadelic progressive house on An
Epiphany of Sound tomorrow between 9a and 11a.  DJ Illiaster provides
the nitro kickoff to the show at 9a and then Jack Triumph follows at
10a.  No coffee necessary (except in writing this BSP.)

Ticket giveaways for you wonderful peeps, as usual!  Be sure to tune in
at 90.1 FM in the bay area or online at http://kzsulive.stanford.edu if
you can't pick us up over the air.  Maybe I'll force them to each play a
track or two from my crate to see how they work it!

Talk atcha tomorrow!

-- 
What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

- Rush Limbaugh. October 5, 1995 show transcript.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Surreal Entertainment and SFBang! productions proudly present!

Winter!
January 31st 2004!!!
Kelly's Mission Rock
817 China Basin
San Francisco, Ca

A mini massive to start the year off with a BANG!! and what better way than 
the joining of 2 crews to mix their magic and make your wildest dreams come 
true. Surreal Entertainment (Known for their yearly Earthdance,Liquid lotus 
festival,Refliections and their Club Further) branching out all the way from 
Arizona to join forces with SF's newest and quickly growing production 
company SFBang!, they brought
you GhettoTechnoSuperCaliExtraBootyLicious and if you attended that you know 
the vibe and you know the rukus and a rocking time to look forward to!

WINTER is going to be SF's First EVER snow party!
dance the night away in the falling snowflakes with 2 brand new artificial 
snow machines! You all are encouraged to wear stylish winter themed 
costumes. The Surreal girls will be there in full effect dressed as sexy 
snow bunnies and snow angels!!! Feel free to join them on the fun!

This party will have somthing for everyone including House, Trance, Breaks, 
Drum and Bass, and some good old fashioned HARDCORE!


Entertainers for the evening:


AK1200 (Planet of the Drums) Orlando FL -Drum and Bass,Jungle-

Jon Bishop (ICU, Tidy Trax) San Diego -HardHouse,Nrg-

Nicholas Bennison (AM recordings,Insomniac,Surreal Entertainment) Los 
Angeles -Tribal,Hard Trance-

Trance- **First California Appearance! and cd release party entitled 'Winter 
2003'**

Dyloot Tom Slick Hayes Joey Mazzola Anthony Mad Lost Boy Reckless Ryan Molly 
Mush vs.Valerie Sparks Jesse Gonzales Dj frequency Justin Hale Felipe Avelar

And Mc's For the Night!
Mc Ragga Banton and Mc L-Ski from the BoomBastik Crew Meeting Mc Fish and 
Axiom for the First time to rock a Very Special *LIVE* DnB and Hip Hop 
MASHUP!

With MANY more Dj's to be announced...

Winter will be at Kelly's Mission rock 817 China Basin San Francisco, Ca and 
  will feature 4 area's with ear numbing sound and mind blowing video 
screens located throughout the event
this is going to be a night of sensory overload! Be prepared for a night of 
Winter time fun and excitement
but please be aware ** This will be a ZERO tolerance event!**
no drugs or weapons of any sort will be allowed to enter the venue.
For those of you 21+ there will be several Full bars for your drinking 
pleasure and
to play and dance the night away in the snow you must be +18 with proper ID.

$17.00
untill January.
$20.00 presales untill the day of the event and $25.00 at the door
Winter will have a 2000 person limited capacity so get your spot in the snow 
while you can!

Subject: [sfraves] Original music contest

Say, does anyone remember a link to a contest where some record
label (I think) was looking for original music submissions for a
compilation album that they were planning to put out?  I just searched
forever and can't find any reference to it, and I can't find any
reference to it in the archives.  Did I dream it?  I DISTINCTLY remember
that the length of the track had to be 4:20 or less (from my memory of
what was on the web page.)

-- 
What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

- Rush Limbaugh. October 5, 1995 show transcript.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites

use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

Subject: Re: [sfraves] www.sfraves.com *site down?*


Because it's sfraves.org

SFRaves.com was an attempt I think by Vitaly (of VORG fame) to create a
rave related virtual community they could profit from... and present their
events in a better light.  Kinda like some other rave community resources
out there.  But I won't spill the beans cause it's so easy to figure out
on your own anyway.

andyw

Oh, if I had to guess, I'd say that both of the above statements are 
complete bullshit.  You got caught making racist slurs on a public 
list, and now you're making up lies in order to try cover for your 
sorry ass.  Michael is 100% correct.  Referring to Japanese people as 
"japs" is exactly like calling black people "niggers", jews "kikes", 
italians "wops", arabs as "towel-heads", and plenty more.  All of these 
are the hallmark of racist trash who have no place anywhere on the 
internet, or in any civilized society.

This reminds me of a rather heated arguement I got into, elsewhere, 
earlier this week; over my observation that the statement: "I am not a 
homophobe/racist/sexist/anti-semite/etc., BUT" (emphesis mine), is 
almost invariably the preamble to a statement that is reprehensibly 
homophobic, racist, sexist, anti-semetic or etc.

People who *really* are not racist/homophobic/sexist/etc. don't have to 
tell anyone as much.  They simply don't behave or speak like one.


cya,
john

--Apple-Mail-1--717177890--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] i am not Raciest [FLASH MOVIE] Japanese ping pong *lol*

B.S.  It's gotten to the point where you have to appologize (i.e. I'm not
racist, but) before you tell
a good joke anymore.  We're all brainwashed by Political Correctness to the
point that anything
that might just maybe possibly be "insensitive" is a no no.  What you're
saying may be true sometimes,
but certainly not all the time by ANY stretch of the imagination.  We are
not all the same, and the
sooner we all get to grips with this FACT the better off we'll all be.  Most
differences are a good
thing, and keep life interesting and unique.  There's nothing wrong with not
being blind to them,
and there's a LOT wrong with ignoring them just to pretend everyone's the
same.  Any person
with common sense should be able to suss out the derogatory / racist etc.
motivated speak from
the rest.  Any person who can't and gets offended at the drop of a hat needs
a clue.

> "japs" is exactly like calling black people "niggers", jews "kikes",
> italians "wops", arabs as "towel-heads", and plenty more.  All of these

> earlier this week; over my observation that the statement: "I am not a
> homophobe/racist/sexist/anti-semite/etc., BUT" (emphesis mine), is
> almost invariably the preamble to a statement that is reprehensibly
> homophobic, racist, sexist, anti-semetic or etc.
>
> People who *really* are not racist/homophobic/sexist/etc. don't have to
> tell anyone as much.  They simply don't behave or speak like one.

>not all the same, and the
>sooner we all get to grips with this FACT the better off we'll all be.

>thing, and keep life interesting and unique.  There's nothing wrong with 
>not
>being blind to them,

> >sooner we all get to grips with this FACT the better off we'll all be.
> >Most
> >differences are a good
> >thing, and keep life interesting and unique.  There's nothing wrong with
> >not
> >being blind to them,
> >and there's a LOT wrong with ignoring them just to pretend everyone's the
> >same.  Any person
> >with common sense should be able to suss out the derogatory / racist etc.
> >motivated speak from
> >the rest.  Any person who can't and gets offended at the drop of a hat
> >needs
> >a clue.
> >
> >----- Original Message -----
> >From: "John B." <SvnLyrBrto@yahoo.com>
> >To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; <red_stickman@yahoo.com>;
> ><DJBigDaddyG@aol.com>
> >Sent: Thursday, January 15, 2004 8:19 PM
> >Subject: Re: [sfraves] i am not Raciest [FLASH MOVIE] Japanese ping pong
> >*lol*

> > > > aslo if you guys are calling me raciest then how come i have this
nice
> > >  > beautifully girl in my life that is Indian and Japanese. And I live
> > > in that overseas
> > >  > in Japan it was a blast.
> > >
> > > Oh, if I had to guess, I'd say that both of the above statements are
> > > complete bullshit.  You got caught making racist slurs on a public
> > > list, and now you're making up lies in order to try cover for your
> > > sorry ass.  Michael is 100% correct.  Referring to Japanese people as
> > > "japs" is exactly like calling black people "niggers", jews "kikes",
> > > italians "wops", arabs as "towel-heads", and plenty more.  All of
these
> > > are the hallmark of racist trash who have no place anywhere on the
> > > internet, or in any civilized society.
> > >
> > > This reminds me of a rather heated arguement I got into, elsewhere,
> > > earlier this week; over my observation that the statement: "I am not a
> > > homophobe/racist/sexist/anti-semite/etc., BUT" (emphesis mine), is
> > > almost invariably the preamble to a statement that is reprehensibly
> > > homophobic, racist, sexist, anti-semetic or etc.
> > >
> > > People who *really* are not racist/homophobic/sexist/etc. don't have
to
> > > tell anyone as much.  They simply don't behave or speak like one.
> > >

Just looked at my calendar, and oh dear... it appears Techno Bombings Are
Scheduled throughout the weekend, please stay indoors and close to a
speaker awaiting further instructions.  That's right boys and girls, after
a bit of a hiatus from proper techno asskicking sessions, I'm making up
for it this weekend with a spazzed out closing set on Saturday (new club
featuring a diet of techno with a side of techno-hyphenations... I'm
almost sure America can handle it!) and a peak hour treatment on Sunday
served with a side of Clarity and appetizer and dessert sets from
Progression's resident pr0gmongers.  Monday's a day off for many of you so
I don't wanna hear no whawha.  Do the right thing, your ass needs techno.

Saturday = HUGGER-MUGGER @ Lit

DJs:   Juan Segovia(tech-on)
Andy W (viberation/refined music/tech-on)
Chameleon (high jinx/tech-on)
Natty D
Lit Lounge is located at 101 6th St. at Mission, San Francisco. Admission
is Free so there is NO excuse!
Tunes from 9pm to 2am.
http://www.tech-on.com


Sunday = PROGRESSION @ 26 MIX

AndyW (viberation/resourcerecords/refinedmusic)
Clairity (Teknotika SF. )
JACK TRIUMPH (FriskyRadio.com, KZSU Radio, Qol Guest)
Illiaster (Stargaze, Butterzone, SNDJ)
Macadio (First Light, Progression)
3024 Mission Street
San Francisco CA. 94110-4502
21+ please 8pm-2am
http://www.jacktriumph.com/email/progression.html

Subject: [sfraves] nrr - i rode a segway (review)


i rode a segway @ disneyland a few weeks ago.

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B00007EPJ6/qid=1074295654//ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i8_xgl23/102-9719423-6680102?v=glance&s=electronics&n=507846


it was everything i was hoping for and more.  it only took me a about a minute to get used to the balance and controls.

i totally loved it!  it was so fun.  now all i can think of is how can i save up $4500 so I can buy one.

it was very responsive and intuitive.  the interface was as basic as can be.

my one regret was that i did not get to test it on the different terrains that it is designed to handle.

to the future *lifts glass in a toast*

JOnas

PUNK THE VOTE
Glenn BurnSilver, Fort Collins Weekly
With punkvoter.com, punk music star Mike Burkett seeks to
change the shape of American politics. But will a few
thousand societal outcasts make a difference? Burkett
thinks so.

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] RR: BREAKS VINYL FOR SALE!!!!!!

Yo kids, I'm making room for new shit in my crates....so I thought I'd post 
this stuff here b4 I put it up on eBay. There's some new(er) stuff, some 
older stuff, a little of this, a little of that...email me if there's 
something on the list you want. I don't overcharge for my stuff and I'll cut 
deals if you buy a bunch. Most of this I'll let go for $5 a pop, but 
there're a few promos and shit that I can't sell for quite that cheap. 'Nuff 
said...here's the vinyl:

Toronto Breaks.com EP - Promo Records (more on the funky tip)

Lightforce - Join Me (Dave London mix) - white label (samples Join Me & 
Children)

Deep Cover - Deeper Inside (original & Koma & Bones mix) - Hope Recordings 
(nuskooler all the way)

Deep Cover - Beatstalker (original & General Midi mix) - Hope Recordings 
(4x4 & breaks mixes - proggy nuskool)

Hyper Presents Y3K Vol.2 - Solid Ground/Uknown Territory, Way Out 
West/Enlightenment, Wayward Soul/PMT Dub - Distinctive (speaks for itself)

Dave London - Get Down Tonight/Your Time Will Come - Yes Mate! (quirkier 
proggy breaks)

Breakneck (Chapter 3) - Halfpipe/T-Break (Ardisson mix) - TCR (Thursday Club 
up to their usual digs)

Flatliners - Sky (original & ILS mixes) - Kilowatt PROMO (deepish, 
darkish,funky)

Koma & Bones - Button Monkey (original & DBJ mixes) - StreetBeat Records 
(nuskool & electro business)

Uberzone & Rennie Pilgrem - Cous Cous (Royale & Superstyle Courgette mixes) 
- TCR (a funkier departure for TCR)

Andy Jarrod - The Fourth K (original & Koma & Bones mixes) - Forged 
Recordings (dark & dirty!!!)

Simply Jeff - Funkengruven/Heart Of Berlin - Electrolife Records (straight 
up electro)

Paul Walker ft. The Incredible Melting Man - Flaky Bastard (original, I.M.M. 
mix & Greg Gow mix) - 2Wars & a Revolution Records (another dark electro & 
nuskool joint)

Friction & Spice - The Rhythm (Cosmic's funky mix & DJ Who's progressive 
mix) - Cosmic Records (funky breaks & 4x4 business)

Aquasky vs. Masterblaster - 777/Magnetic Forces/Frequency - Botchit & 
Scarper PROMO (white label promo action!!!!)

Initial Research - Visitors(UFO)/Killer Instinct - MOB records (another 
nuskool joint)

Terminalhead - The Vibe/OFI pt.1 - White Label (If you don't know this one, 
you've been under a rock!)

Thursday Club - Paranoia/Soundbwoy/Crispy - TCR Records (a classic on BLUE 
VINYL!!!)

Hybrid - If I Survive (Beber & Hybrid mixes) - Distinctive (proggier nuskool 
action)

FreqNasty present Y4K (sampler) - Phil Kieran/Voices in My Head (Plastic 
Perverts mix) & Almighty Beatfreakz/Resident Soundboyz - Distinctive (do I 
even need to say anything about this?)

Chris Carter - Echo Babylon (original & Atomic Hooligan mixes) - Botchit 
Breaks (you get the point..hehehe)

Clone Therory - Electrolennium/Technolennium - Qube Records (darker 
electro/techno)

Raw 24 - ??? - white label promo

Dobrag - The Counter Attack EP (pt.1 of 2) - Swell Recordings (electro 
nastiness)

Hard Hop Heathen & John Kelley - Impending Boom E (nuskool, techno,D&B, hard 
trance mixes) - Tricked Out Recordings (breaks mix is RUGGED)

Meat Beat Manifesto - Prime Audio Soup (original,dub,Boards Of Canada mix & 
Herbaliser mix) - Nothing Records (dark proggy breaks)

B.L.I.M. - Lost pt. 2 (Crazy Things/Coming To) - TCR (w/ help from Meat 
Katie!)

Silken - Reach Out (Spoon Wizard & An-ten-nae mixes) - Functional Breaks 
(you oughtta know this one kids!)

Vitae - Energy Flow (original & Nick Sentience mixes) - Distinctive (good 
pumpin' beats)

HardOn Music Sampler pt.1 - Hydromechanical Acoustics (2x12"/8 Tracks) - 
Hardon Music (dark ass nuskool/electro featuring the likes of Dj Czech, Robb 
G & GTM)

Kaistar - Promethean Groove (original & Rennie Pilgrem Thursday Club mix) - 
City Of Angels (come on now!)


Marc(O)

DC/MD/VA

Saturday, January 17, 2004 ** Cold Phusion Winter Music Festival by BR Prod=
uctions, Next Level Promotions, and KCRH 89.9FM **

 he COLD PHUSION Winter Music Festival! Line-up TEASER!!! COLD PHUSION will=
 feature over 40+ Artists performing on 4 MASSIVE stages of sound! THE WARP=
 BROS: The legendary Warp Brothers - DJ's Oliver Goedicke and J=FCrgen Dohr=
=2E It did not take a long time and their first single Phatt Bass hit the G=
erman market and made it to the top 3 in the dance charts! Shortly after th=
is they entered the Sales-Charts Europe wide up to the #2! No wonder that t=
hey draw the music business attention, with placing a solid techno-track in=
 the sales-charts.Shortly after their uplifting style flooded Europe, the w=
ave swept over to the US, Canada, Australia and Japan. You might somehow co=
mpare the style of the Warp Brothers to Prodigy or Chemical Brothers but th=
e truth is that they created their own creative and unique sound, like you =
can read in an article of the Face magazine. Although the Warp Brothers are=
 friendly people - they are in possession of a lethal weapon, which is call=
ed Harder House. Remarkable is their success in the UK sales-charts #9 and =
Top 10 positions in several Sales -Charts.In Denmark they were rewarded wit=
h gold. Undoubted the Warpies as they are keenly called by their fans turn =
it up on stage! DJ DRC: San Francisco's Pioneer DJ DRC has relocated to New=
 York City and is geared up to take the Electronic Music Industry by storm.=
 With her Mixed Album "UNDEFINED" in the works and a list of releases on IM=
IX, Vision Music, Off World, Merge, Twin Soul and her own label Undefined M=
usik, DRC equivocates the expeditious pace of her new stomping grounds. Her=
 original music is also featured in two movies, "Vision of Vibe" with Carl =
Cox and "Intellect" being released this February 2003, featuring Paul Van D=
yk and many others. DRC's latest single SEEKER can be heard on the SPANKEE =
clothing line websight. With all this under her belt and more, it is obviou=
s DRC has already had her finger on the pulse of the Big Apple/ Manhattan. =
DRC Returns to S.F. for a special set at COLD PHUSION! PLUS MORE CALIFORNIA=
 SUPERSTARS.... DJ JMARR (BR Productions/Liquid Vinyl DJs), FELIPE AVELAR (=
BR Productions/ djfelipeavelar.com / bigfloor traxx), THE DOCTOR (BR Produc=

pro=B7gres=B7sion n. The process of progressing; progress.
Movement from one member of a continuous series to the next.
A continuous series; a sequence.

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions launches 'Pr=
ogression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail some se=
rious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the best, most=
 intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory experien=

o join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of acceptance, com=
radery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our underground movem=
ent, with its roots founded on electronic music and our personal desire to =
expose it to everyone.

Friday, January 23, 2004 ** SOMA Sessions w/Marcus Intalex **

SOMA Sessions
Fourth Fridays @ AsiaSF

For the inaugural session we bring you, all the way from Manchester UK, the=
 sounds of:

MARCUS INTALEX (Soul:r, MIST - UK)
Marcus Intalex is known across the globe for his infectious, smooth style o=
f Drum 'n Bass. Only a few years after his first production efforts in 1995=
 on Flex and his own Intalex Productions imprint came anthems such as "How =
You Make Me Feel," "Love & Happiness" and "Universe," which firmly position=
ed Marcus as one of the world's top D&B personalities. Today, Marcus and lo=
ngtime studio partner, S.T. Files continue to blaze trails as M.I.S.T. with=
 their wildly popular Soul:r label. With over a decade of experience on the=
 decks, SOMA Sessions is proud to welcome back to San Francisco one of the =
UK's most in-demand Drum 'n Bass DJs.

METHOD ONE (Cov.Ops, method-one.com)
By 1994 Method One was both an acclaimed DJ and and experienced rave promot=
er in Philly. By 1996 he was also an established producer. Recording with p=
artner Kaos as Atlantiq, Method One signed tunes to labels like Good Lookin=
g and True Intent while holding down DJ residencies at Konkrete Jungle and =
Dieselboy's Platinum. Since relocating to the Bay, Jason continues to wreck=
 dancefloors with his diverse DJ sets and release top-shelf tunes on labels=
 such as ASC's Covert Operations.

Resident Support:
DJ M
SOUND:BOY

10:30pm - 3am
For discount presale tickets, mailing list and more information visit http:=
//somasessions.com

Friday, February 6, 2004 ** *Oneiromancy* presented by Oneiromancy **

Doing things different from other crews, admission to this event will be fr=
ee of charge. We are working on the lineup, but as with all our events, we =
want to extend a special invite to all the new DJs who have never played an=
 event. We are setting aside a number of timeslots, in various genres, so i=
f you are dying to get out there to play, email me at wavelength_sf@yahoo.c=
om, with the subject "Oneiromancy" Be sure to include contact info, links t=
o demos (if you have one), and genre. I know everyone plays every genre, bu=
t if you could limit it to one, that would help. I'm going to randomly draw=
 names to play for each genre, so DJs who play a genre that is under-repres=
ented will have a better shot. Its all random: I dont care if we are friend=
s, enemies, whatever. I'll post the list the day after christmas, so thats =
the deadline. Oh yes, and unlike other times, hardcore DJs will definatly g=
et slots at this party. Hope to see you guys there. (look for the full line=
up the day after christmas. ) More info TBA.

Saturday, February 21, 2004 ** ***Mirage*** presented by Illumination Recor=
ds, Hardscience, and friends **

As many of you may know already, Mirage first appeared as a Wednesday club =
night here in San Jose. Unfortunately, as with many nightclubs in the scene=
, the venue was sold and new owners came in to change the club into a blues=
-rock bar. Mirage with its family and friends enjoyed a fun 2003 run and th=
e night vanished just before winter. Recently, we were told that Mirage wil=
l once again take shape in February. All who were involved with Mirage will=
 return to help recreate the magic and build a safe-haven for its reappeara=
nce. As the prophets give us more information, we will forward the details =
to you. Returning to the source of power are Mirage resident DJs: Michael L=
iu (Illumination Records), Denise (Sound Asylum), Dragn'fly (Shaolin), Maje=
re (Elektrosorcery), and Proteus (Vibe Rite). Crisp clean concert sound pow=
ered by Logik Pro. Much more information to follow on this all ages event..=
=2E If you wish to help direct your positive energies to the rematerializat=
ion of Mirage, please get in touch.
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1069

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1031

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: House parties...

Tonight was another reminder of why I love house parties. Good ol' Jack 
Triumph persuaded me a week or so ago to meet him in Fremont for a lil' 
shindig his friend's were throwing, and it turned out ot be a fun time. Of 
course the fact that I to to spin made it that much better ( I've only been  
spinning maybe once every month or so since i got here due to faulty 
equipment and tight budget). Either way tho, it was a fun time...and godamm 
if JT doesn't pull out all the stops. He's got a great and varied track 
selection, and the skills to play 'em. It's always a pleasure.

Anyhoo...my night ends on a good note! Hope to see some of you's out and 
about tomorrow night. Perhaps at either the Old Skool jammy at DNA, or maybe 
at that super hush hush (not really) breaks party happening in SF.

ez.

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Substructure//Mario Bros.

hello, this is simply a continuation of a fictional piece that we are using our space to post, for your pleasure alone, of course:
 
she was at the top of her game, as they say. freshly cropped do, short and friendly, a little tired and bleary eyed, but things were definately different now. laura picked up the telephone, sank back into the old brown couch, and dialed with a smile when she heard a familar footstep on the stairs. she was at the top of her game, and today, she would not be giving it up to miss jane. she sunk down low in her seat, shut the phone off, and didn't hardly stir. :)

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: More vinyl 4 sale! (mixed bunch)

Aiight folks, here's some more stuff that's destined for eBay if locals 
don't buy it 1st. This next batch is mixed. There's a bunch of progressive, 
some goa/psy, old skool, tech-house,trance, house etc. Prices listed are 
negotiable, and I definately give price breaks if you buy in bulk.

1. unknown - Hey You - white label (progressive tribally track sampling Pink 
Floyd's "Hey You") - $15

2. Jamaican Vibes - Exodus - Weekend Records (House & breaks remixes of Bob 
Marley's song "Exodus") - $8

3. Carl Cox - Does It Feel Good To You? - Perfecto Records (one of the 1st 
Perfecto releases, old skool techno circa '92) - $10

4. v/a - All Boundaries Are Illusions Compilation (3x12") - 21:3 Records 
(this is a rare OOP Compilation from the legendary 21:3 Label - Goa/Psy at 
it's peak! Includes work from Eat Static, ManMadeMan, Medicine Drum & more. 
Also includes the track "SKWIRM" by Andy Guthrie aka FUNKOPATH which was the 
opening track on the 1st HARDDESERTTRANCE compilation on Moonshine Records) 
- $30

5. 3 Tolo - Big Tock EP - StreetBeat Records (run of the mill prog.) $4

6. Paul Oakenfold - Hypnotised (Deepsky & Kowalski mixes) - Perfecto 
(typical 1015 fare) - $4

7. Memnon - Desire (2x12") - MusicNow (classic prog. w/ reworks by PFn vs. 
The Light, Jondi & Spesh & Oko Tek!) - $8

8. Oliver Klein - Rheinkraft - Leaded (harder prog/trance, very dark number) 
- $5

9. Ouija - Back To Earth/Shit Happens - Naja Records (darker prog./trance) - 
$4

10. Henrik B - Recollections EP - Drumcode (4 tracker by a techno master!) - 
$5

11. Liquid 22 - The Life In My Eyes/My Joy - white label  (big "hands in the 
air" trancers - one samples the classical tune "Ode To Joy") - $4 ((2 copies 
available))

12. Brainbug - Benedictus - Groovealicious ('97 main room trancey house) - 
$3

13. Jan Driver - Soulshaker - Groovealicious ('99 NYC style prog.house) - $3

14. Tommi White - Pushin'/In his Ear - Oblong records (newer Sander K style 
stuff) - $3

15. DJ Donut - Beat Your Record EP - InfiniteBeat Records (house,prog,breaks 
mixes) - $2

16. Jeff Mills - Steampit EP (Alarms/Native High/Automatic/Ride The Rhythm) 
- Purpose Maker ('97 action by one of the top names in techno!) - $6

17. Kings Of Punani - Fantasy Girl - "white" label (Christian Smith & Alexi 
Delano techy housin' it up!) - $4

18. Takkyu Ishino - Suck Me Disco - Exceptional Records (run of the mill 
techno/house) - $2

19. The Youngsters - Abusive Melody EP - F Communications (energetic 
tech-house) - $3

20. Pariah - Keep The Peace - Rhythm Syndicate  ('00 era prog.) $3

21. Mara - Lateral Horizon (Mara & Pablo Gargano mixes) - ChooCHoo Records 
(nice chunky prog.) - $5

22. Jimpy - Valley Of The Kings - Southeast Records (prog.) - $3

23. Secret Society (Justin Johnson & 3P0) - Stolen - Cable Recordings 
(techno/house w/ addtl. remix work by Selway) - $3

- Distinctive - (prog.) - $4

mixes) - Acetate Ltd. (hard prog. & nuskool mixes) - $5

(tech-electro-house) - $10

you don't know what this is, you've been under a rock!) - $15

Subject: [sfraves] 12 Hr Adventure w/ a =) Ending: Sat Night!

OK... so I wake up like around 1 something & get this mondo message on my answering machine... it like totally took me hella long & alot repeats of the message 2 figure out it was Atomic (atawmic on SFR) who left the message, so i called him right away!  He told me that like he was on his way 2 my pad already & I was all... "Oh Wow.. OK... Bad Ass!!"  'Cause he said there was this Awesome shindig he wanted 2 go 2... la la la... so he comes over & we go...

4:30 PM ~~> We leave Skills & got presales 4 Cold Fushion... long story short (wait... can i really tell a short story?)... we got 2 Chabot College after this mondo drive all around Berk, Oak, & Hayward 'cause well... info line was updated & we were kinda goin' of Tom's (Slik) directions... so i called him @ the store & told him it wasn't @ the 1st place he said it was & he did this huge search online & found the location & gave us directions (It was so Groovy seein' him & talkin' 2 him again! We sooo had sooo much 2 catch up on =)  So yeah... we got there & like well..i dunno man... we stayed 4 like 3 hours i think & that whole time... all they had in all the inside rooms was like trance.... nothing wrong w/ that at all... it's jus' that well... shouldn't it be like diversified esp like @ an early time since ya know, people could choose like what room they wanna spin in?  I mean.. well... yeah.. it pretty much broke probably during the last part of our stay there 'cause well
 ... 1 room had jungle, another had NRG, another had house (w/ these awesome circle dancers)  

BUt another thing that kinda sucked was sound... 1 of the rooms was the gym... another was the cafateria... another room was a huge hallway room thingie... so yeah.. there was mondo reverbage in the rooms & it kinda made the bass do that echo bounce stuff like crazy... I mean... it was bearable 'cause i had ear plug which made it sound kinda normal... well.. maybe i'm prejudging 'cause we were there still early & left early & there wasn't that many people yet 2 fill the room to drown out the reverb echo stuff... but yeah.. that was a prob... i esp felt bad 4 Arson when he spn 'cause well... his jungle kinda sounded like trance 'cause it got 2 bass heavy in the room & the bass echo made his Jungle sound like trance... LoL  

But on the vibe tip... i did see alota people there & that made me happy!=)  yeah... i did dance a lil' also...

so then like we headed over 2 Sublounge 4 that Jungle thingaround like 10 Something PM... there was 1 DJ there that i really liked ummm... kid bippy i think his name is who was really Awesome =)  I also met some people og the Groundscore MB there... but i dunno... there wasn't that many people there & Atomic & did play video games 4 like 3/4th of the time there... it was still early though, but we left & headed out 2 Amnesia 4 Hemisphere...

OK...that was fun!!  LoL... it was crazy packed there... I mean.. this is like the only 3rd Hempishere i been 2 as long as it's been goin' on & I dunno... Valencia on a Sat night is pretty crazy, so yeah.. there were looooooooooooooooots of people there... it was fun tryin' 2 dance in therem but it was so mondo hard man... saw hella faces there & damn man... ziggy was Dope on the mic when some dude was there spinning.. i dunno who it was... but i guess Atomic wasn't feeling the vibe & there were hella people there who came from DNA & hella people who were still gonna go there from Amnesia... so Atomic suggested that we should go... & we did

Around 12:30- 1:00 AM we get 2 DNA Lounge 4 the 10 yr Anniversary thingie... Good Fuckin' Shit man.. heeeeeeeeeeeeeeella people in there... i mean... i have never been 2 DNA & it was that packed, well... maybe 1 tim.. no... it was waaaaay packed & man.. crazy!!  Jeno was on the decks & he was rockin' it fuckin hard man... jus' alota good ol fashion house & I think he mighta thrown in some breakbeats in there... but it was So Dope!  It was Groovy, i talk 2 him after his set & he was like caught up on the haps w/ each other... he told me this story about his son & how he's in a basketball league & how like he hmmmm... i couldn't get parts of the story 'we were talkin' right next 2 the monitor... but he said somehthing about it was like a Rave @ his son's game or something hmmm.. maybe he was talkin' about DNA... LoL

I also got 2 kick w/ Felix Woof Woof the dog & that was Groovy 'cause i don't see that dork enough.,... I was hella bummed that we missed his set... 

Hmmmmm... I danced a lil' here & there @ DNA... but I dunno man... there was jus' 2 many people there & stuff & it was hard 2 totally get my groove & be free on the floor like I wanted 2... I dunno... maybe I bein' a bitch or something... la la la... 

But serously though... I saw so much family there that night... I even saw people i ain't seen in soooooooooooooooooo long there it was Dope!  I mean... it kinda got 2 a point where like I started getting kinda teary eyed happy 2 C so many faces 2gether & stuff, but it was so damn <3 warming!

OK.. but what really totally mondo got me so more teary eyed happy was well.... early in the night @ DNA... there was this Dude there i kept poppin in2 & looked mondo familiar... hmmmmm... ok... so i'm outside like smoking & talkin' 2 people & bump in2 this guy again... i look @ him like strait in the eye & lol... the 1st thing he said 2 me was, "Finally U talk 2 me after i been seein' u 2night" & I was like "huh... Im confused... i know u.. right?"  Then we like hug & he asks me what my name is...

"Osby... I'm Osby Dude" I said as were hugging.\

"Ooooo shit, dude... what the fuck man.. long time so see Bro" he said as he hugged me tighter.

"Huh?" I said w/ a small laugh. "U still ain't told me your name homie."

"Osby... it's me Rocky!  Remember from waaaaaaay back in the day?" he said.

"Hello 2Day.. Oh Fuckin' A man.. Rocky!" I said like totallly happy!

See.. Rocky was some1 i started partying w/ when i started 9 years ago... we ain't seen each other  in like 7 years & shit so like Hello 2day... it was like sooooooooooooooo Awesome seein' him again after this whole time & it's kinda like full circle, symbolic, & ironic that him & I bumped in2 each other @ an event that celebrated the 10 yr anniversary of the DJs who spun or something like that... but yeah man... it was Dope!  I mean... Atomic & I were on the edge of leafing @ that time... but man... running in2 Rocky again... we kinda stayed like 1/2 hr- 45 minutes longer jus' talkin'!

4:30 AM... we on 80 almost 2 Hercules... I was still kind teary eyed happy in the car after bumpin' in2 Rocky... but yeah... it was a Bad Ass night =)  Man... i wish i brought my camera! =\  But yeah... Hello 2Day...happy ending... ok.. time 2 sleep.. my parents are down stairs havin' breakfast now & I should get some zzzzzzzzzzzs... Good Morning!

Take Care,
Peace-> ObY {8O)

X-Scanned-By: MIMEDefang 2.38
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Congress to Ban Marijuana Reform Ads - TAKE ACTION

ACTION ALERT: PROTECT FREE SPEECH AND YOUR WALLET

*** Congress to ban private advertising in support of marijuana law
reform *** At same time, Congress to spend $145 million in tax money on
govt.  anti-marijuana ads

In December, Rep. Ernest Istook, an Oklahoma Republican, snuck language
into a federal spending bill that will effectively ban private
advertising on buses, subways, or trains in support of marijuana law
reform - including campaign ads in support of medical marijuana ballot
measures. Worse still, the same bill also spends $145 million in
taxpayer money on anti-marijuana government propaganda. This federal
spending bill passed the U.S. House of Representatives late last year,
and the U.S. Senate will most likely vote on it next week.

If you haven't faxed your Senators yet, please do so today. While there
is only a small chance that we can stop this bill from passing (the
reason why drug war extremists snuck this censorship provision into it),
we need to show Congress that voters are outraged. We need to show that
we have your support and the support of the American people.

ACTIONS TO TAKE

1) Fax your Senators and tell them to protect free speech. You can fax
them for free at
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/index.asp?step=2&item=13704&ms=achpfsad

2) Forward this alert to your friends, family, and co-workers. We need
thousands of Americans to fax Congress.

MORE INFORMATION

Every year Congress passes 13 federal spending bills providing money to
various federal agencies. Sometimes the House passes a spending bill
that is different from a bill the Senate passes. When that is the case,
Congress appoints what is called a "conference committee" to reconcile
differences between the two bills. This conference committee then sends
a final version of the bill to both the House and Senate for one final
up and down vote, with no chance for amendments. Members of the
conference committee frequently add controversial things to the spending
bill at the last minute, knowing that their colleagues won't vote
against an entire spending bill just because one thing in it is
controversial.

This year Congressional leadership decided to reconcile multiple
spending bills within one conference committee, producing a single
federal spending bill (known as an "omnibus" spending bill) to send to
the House and Senate floor for a final vote. This tactic allowed them to
slip in all sorts of controversial things they could not otherwise pass
into law. They know that Members of Congress are unlikely to vote
against such an omnibus funding bill just because they don't like some
of its parts.

During conference, House and Senate leaders loaded up the omnibus bill
(HR 2673) with dozens of controversial provisions. One such provision,
added by Rep. Ernest Istook Jr. (R-OK), would prohibit any transit
system that receives federal funds from running advertising for groups
that want to decriminalize or legalize marijuana. If enacted, it would
prevent drug policy reform groups from buying ad space on buses, trains,
and subways around the country. It would prevent us from getting our
message directly to the American people.

At the same time, the omnibus bill gives the Office of National Drug
Control Policy (ONDCP) $145 million to run anti-marijuana ads next year.
ONDCP has already spent taxpayer money on television commercials
comparing drug users to terrorists and claiming that smoking marijuana
will make you a pregnant rape victim, make you shoot your neighbor, or
make you run over little kids with your car. This year's ads could be
even more outrageous.

The omnibus spending bill was approved by the House last year and the
Senate will likely vote on the bill sometime during the week of January
19. Because the bill cannot be amended to remove the controversial
provisions, the only way to prevent them from becoming law is if a
majority of the Senate votes against the entire omnibus bill. While this
is very unlikely, it is possible.

The Drug Policy Forum of Massachusetts Coalition is urging voters to
contact their U.S. Senators and tell them to vote against the omnibus
spending bill because it was put together in an undemocratic manner and
contains provisions that suppress free speech.

You can fax your Members of Congress for free at
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=3D469304&l=3D11028

For a Washington Post news story on the controversial provision, see:
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=3D469304&l=3D11029

The full text of the very large omnibus bill can be viewed by going to
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=3D469304&l=3D11030
and  clicking =DDon HR2673.

The relevant provision can be viewed here:
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=3D469304&l=3D11031

Excerpts from the conference report can be viewed here:
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=3D469304&l=3D11032
______________________________________________________________________

The Drug Policy Forum of Massachusetts Coalition is a statewide,
nonprofit organization seeking to reduce the harms associated with drug
use and our drug laws.

Please help us bring about more just and compassionate laws by making a
donation today! Contact us at Drug Policy Forum of Massachusetts
Coalition, 101 Tremont Street, Suite 509, Boston, MA 02108, (617)
426-7979, info@dpfma.org.

Aaaaaaaight!  Tonight's yet another installment of Dirtbox Radio, comin
atcha via a buttload of electrons and wires and whatnot, straight to them
computer speakers of yours.

This week's guest DJs are DJ Haaps and Bizar.  Haaps spins both breaks and
DNB, and does it well either way, so we'll see exactly what he has in
store for us tonight.  Bizar rolls hard, dnb style, and has a viscious
arsenal of released and unreleased tunes.  We're glad to have both of 'em
out tonight.

Timeslots:
07-08pm EST - Intro Hour w/ ODJ & Jerel
08-09:30pm EST - Bizar
09:30-11pm EST - Haaps
11-??am EST - Outro w/ ODJ, Jerel, and maybe some other cats.

Ze links (avail 24/7 @ dirtboxradio.com):
128k: http://64.246.60.15:8800/listen.pls
64k: http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls

chat: http://jungletrain.net/index.php?page=2&subpage=0&color=2
webcam (new and improved):
http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

If you'd like to come out and join the madness that is Dirtbox Radio, hit
us off with a mix of some sort.  If you're too far to come out physically,
we'll air the mix on the show.  Send all mix/booking/free ass type stuff
to bookme@dirtboxradio.com.

Remember to come out periodically and check out dirtboxradio.com for
archives of past shows, photos, up-to-date information and guest
appearances, and other types of stuff.

Ok well that's enough digital blabber outta me for the night.  See you
fools in teh chat.

Ez!

I really doubt there'll be much effect from something like this. It sounds a
lot like how during the Ed Rosenthal trial, how the court was attempting to
ban any defense of "for medical use" from any of the cases arguments. .
.Eventually tho the courts people lost their powerful message (Ed
Rosenthal), and lost the court battle as it rightly should.
I never watch news, but when I do see some type of newsx, or read about it,
it's all about corruption and judges trying to make up their own rules for
personal vendetta's . . .

Decision seems to me to somehow be ultimately decided by the state, which is
good. I think us people have lil power over national court and gov't
decisions, states seem to be more influenced by the taxpayers. . . but thats
just my thought.

Lil do people know but Nevada actually Legallized marijuana by popular vote
for a couple months. For a short time there was a somewhat commercialized
distribution of cannabis, street vendors, stores. . .There were several
commercial packaged cannabis products that were available. Just for a lil
bit tho. And this was maybe like 7-8 years ago. That tho, didn't really have
anything to do with medical use. . .it was reg sales. . . like cigs. . .

OCBC has a ton of info that's constantly updated about the local area
cannabis acts and the national movement.  Court trials, things like that.

The cool thing about all of this is that all the advocators, protectors,
fighters for the cannabis movement and medicinal use acts. . . they're
almost all totally local.
It's like the cannabis producers of the country, in the top 2-3 would be
"Oakland/ Bay area CA"

yknow when you're randomly driving and you smell like skunk green in the
air. . .

when is the last time you saw an actual skunk. . .

: )

aK

Well, not sure what flavor of Kool-Aid everyone was into last night, =
but, last night was great. Not sure if it had to do with jack blessing =
the beginning of the night with a rough interpretation of techno and =
Ossby literally walking in as Jack was thinking 'man wouldn't oss dig =
this leftfield track'. Perhaps it was clairity and andyw laying down =
wicked [actual] techno sets, or Illiaster's 'creamfield's or bust' set. =
It could have been Bam sneaking in the back door so he didn't have to =
show his ID and then complaining the drinks were weak, lol. It could =
have been any number of people that I didn't expect to see, showing up =
to support; or, it could have been a great closing night to our little =
nino 'progression'. Whatever it was I think everyone agreed it worked.=20

Thanks for sending us out on a Bang. Much love out to our guests =
Clairity & AndyW for giving us evil progressive people an education in =
Techno.

@ 26Mix, with special guest DJ Floorcraft. And yes, we are still calling =
it Progression; I think seeing as we're moving, it couldn't fit more.

***The National Electronic Dance Music Conference***


http://www.nedmc.com

  In Washington D.C. on September 3rd through 6th 2004, the National EDM =
Conference will take place at=20

the Omni Shoreham Hotel. We will be utilizing the entire space of the =
hotel to bring you the best=20

possible environment to network with others in the EDM industry. We will =
be hosting all genres, from hip=20

hop to hardcore, from house to industrial. As well, we will also be =
showcasing the newest technologies=20

for the coming year and beyond, as well as offering seminars and focus =
groups to help dj's, producers,=20

and gear manufacturer's push the envelope of music production and =
presentation.

  We have chosen D.C. to host this event because it is a central =
location on the east coast, offering=20

easy access from many spots around the country, as well as being home to =
one of the nations largest EDM=20

focused communities. We will be working closely with all businesses =
involved to ensure top notch=20

production on all sides for after hours events, as well as =
demonstrations of said products. There will be=20

also attendee only events, so be sure to sign up early to gain access to =
these events, held exclusively=20

in the hotel.

  For further information on either sponsoring, exhibiting, attending, =
or hosting an official event,=20

please email info@nedmc.com , or visit our site at http://www.nedmc.com =
.

  If you would like to help out with the NEDMC, please e-mail =
info@nedmc.com for intern and volunteering=20

opportunites.=20


http://www.nedmc.com

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Martin Luther King, Jr.

--=====================_700306==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in his own words:

Nonviolence means avoiding not only external physical violence but also 
internal violence of spirit. You not only refuse to shoot a man, but you 
refuse to hate him.

- Martin Luther King Jr.


I said to my children, "I'm going to work and do everything that I can do 
to see that you get a good education. I don't ever want you to forget that 
there are millions of God's children who will not and cannot get a good 
education, and I don't want you feeling that you are better than they are. 
For you will never be what you ought to be until they are what they ought 
to be.'

- Martin Luther King Jr., 1.7.68


I submit that an individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is 
unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to 
arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality 
expressing the highest respect for law.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Letter From Birmingham Jail ", 4.16.63


In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence 
of our friends.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "The Trumpet of Conscience", 1967


We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Remaining Awake Through A Great Revolution ", 
3.31.68


Whatever career you may choose for yourself -- doctor, lawyer, teacher -- 
let me propose an avocation to be pursued along with it. Become a dedicated 
fighter for civil rights. Make it a central part of your life. It will make 
you a better doctor, a better lawyer, a better teacher. It will enrich your 
spirit as nothing else possibly can. It will give you that rare sense of 
nobility that can only spring from love and selflessly helping your fellow 
man . Make a career of humanity. Commit yourself to the noble struggle for 
human rights. You will make a greater person of yourself, a greater nation 
of your country, and a finer world to live in.

- Martin Luther King Jr., 4.18.59


Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided 
missiles and misguided man.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Strength to Love", 1963


A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military 
defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "The Trumpet of Conscience", 1967


Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still 
plant my apple tree.

- Martin Luther King Jr., quoting Martin Luther


Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor; it must be demanded by 
the oppressed.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Letter From Birmingham Jail ", 4.16.63


I submit to you that if a man hasn't discovered something he will die for, 
he isn't fit to live.

- Martin Luther King Jr., 6.23.63


I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the 
starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and 
brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and 
unconditional love will have the final word.

- Martin Luther King Jr., Nobel Prize Acceptance Speech , 12.10.64


If you succumb to the temptation of using violence in the struggle, unborn 
generations will be the recipients of a long and desolate night of 
bitterness, and your chief legacy to the future will be an endless reign of 
meaningless chaos.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Justice Without Violence", 4.3.57


It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can keep him 
from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important.

- Martin Luther King Jr., Wall Street Journal, 11.13.62


Never succumb to the temptation of bitterness.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Strength to Love", 1963


Rarely do we find men who willingly engage in hard, solid thinking. There 
is an almost universal quest for easy answers and half-baked solutions. 
Nothing pains some people more than having to think.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Strength to Love", 1963


The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: "If I stop to 
help this man, what will happen to me?" But... the good Samaritan reversed 
the question: "If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?"

- Martin Luther King Jr., "I've Been to the Mountain Top ", 4.3.68


The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort 
and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Strength to Love", 1963


The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists 
who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Strength to Love", 1963


The time is always right to do what is right.

- Martin Luther King Jr., "Letter From Birmingham Jail ", 4.16.63



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

X-Mailer: AT&T Message Center Version 1 (Oct 27 2003)

Subject: [sfraves] One night in SF: attitudes vs. progressions

Sunday night I got invited to the premiere of a Bear party called Maul, but I almost got thrown out of the den. I guess I need more inhibitions.

This monthly (at the Cherry in SOMA) has house music and dancing. It was hot inside and the vibe was unfriendly. Lots of guys had their shirts off, though, and I was prepared for sweaty dancing because I had shorts under my jeans and a muscle-T, too. 

So at one point I guess I wanted to get mauled. I took my pants off, a big mistake at this party. Now if this sounds crazy, keep in mind that this was a gay bear party and everyone was shirtless. Plus I was wearing tennis shorts, not boxers (totally street legal). I started dancing until someone actually picked up my folded pants nearby. Dont know what they were looking for but I was upset about it.

So I grabbed my stuff, left the floor and headed to the chill room. I relaxed on the sofa. No one else was around. It was comfortable and I was tired. I cooled down, put my pants back on, and just sat there, quietly. Suddenly, the bouncer arrived in the chill room doorway. He asked if I was the guy who was lying around getting naked. I said, Yeah, whats up, I was in my shorts. Its hot in here. He said, The people up front have a problem with you. We have cops around here. 

I was fully dressed, so I just said, Hey, Im not cruising, whats the big deal. Im going to another party anyway.

They must have problems with hustlers and the vice squad. I left and Mr. Bouncer said, Come back next month. I just grinned because sometimes San Francisco does not seem liberated to me, just uptight. 

So I went over to 26Mix on Mission Street for the last Progression and had a damn fine time with the good people in a vibe of extreme comfort. Jack greeted me inside with a warm hug. Osby did the same outside (with Dahlia). Later, Brandon showed up and so did lots of other peeps! We had a good crowd. And AndyW was spinning the hard banging techno! Man, I had so much fun, dancing like a fool, but I didnt take my pants off this time.

I just wanted to say that I am so glad to be a part of the Sfraves communitywhere I always meet my people and have excellent dance adventures with no attitudes, just good intentions.

Please remember to greet new faces, and be friendly to strangers who might show up at our events. It makes the world a better place. PLUR, and keep your pants on in San Francisco.

Greg VP

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] Big Trance returns to the BARN! 1.30.04

a while, we have an opportunity to take it to this level, so please don't 
miss this party.  if you recall infected mushroom or sun project or astral 
projection or cosmosis or logic bomb at the barn - arms in the air at 6am, 
then you know what you're in for:

D.M.T. PRESENTS:

TICON - Live!
(Digital Structures / Sweden)

NEUROMOTOR - Live!!
(acidance / mechanik records, Spain)

the best of the neo full-on sound!)

((Thump Radio))

Subject: [sfraves] Refried Beans, Progression Review, & wet pants

So Sunday was like well... I really wanted 2 start working on my paper this weekend 4 school.. but well... i didn't... LoL

So after goin' 2 a lil' Fam Gathering w/ Atomic, then goin' 2 the airprt 2 pick up George NewStyleSound w/ Amber, I got dropped of @ 26 Mix 4 Progression... but I got hungry & like totally ate @ this MExcian resuraunt 1st like next door... mmmm.. yeah... I kinda stuffed myself there... but yeah... Delia was with me...  then I went in 2 26Mix & Jack Triupmh was on the decks playin' his proggy house but ok.. Hello 2Day.. when I got in... he said "Osby, This next tRacks 4 U" & he busted out this HELLO 2Day, so damn yummy Breatbeats track that I fuckin' Creamed over man!!!  Loved it!!!

Clarity went on next & spun this really Dope minimal techno set that I Loved!!  Oh MyGoodness man... it was really CooL 'cause like well... her set was pretty steady w/ this constant Groove... then she got kinda more heavy w/ he Tachno beats towards the end of her set, but still playin minimal stuff... Loved it!!!

Then ok... LoL.. Andy Went on & played house.. I mean.. it was like chill kinda house @ the begining i guess... but as his set progressed... his beats were getting harder & welll.. he may of slipped in a techno record or 2 in there... I could sworn i heard some electro in there... but i definetly heard some Ghetto Tek!!  I Loved his set!!

It was a fun time there @ Progreesion... alota people showed up & it was fun hangin' out, Mondo Groovy Vibe... the most trippiest thing was seein' 1 of my old bouncer homies from Blakes there after like hella years & shit man... it was Trippy 'cause we ain't seen each other like in 2 years & he happens 2 B homies w. Mr Triumph... so Dope!  BUt yeah.. it was a Groovy Vibe & I'm excited 4 the next 1!

Unfortunately... i didn't stay 4 AndyW's whole set 'cause well... Jaze came by & well... there was a car load of our friends who came along & couldn't exactly come inside... so we went 2 the beach instead, kept a pre lit fire burning, played in the water, & hung out w/ these guys from Europe who likes West Coast rap!

This has been 1 of the most Awesome Weekends I've had in a long time... I'm in all honesty... I'm still buggin' that I saw Rocky again after 7 years & man... so Dope... & yeah... I'm happy I got 2 hang out w/ Atomic again after a while... so yeah... I still thik i need 2 catch up on my sleep 7 work on my paper 4 class.. so Have a Groovy week every1! =)

Take Care,
Peace-> ObY {8O)

- 10th.

I received the email below from Patrick, who is on the list but couldn't 
post this.  The link will take you to an article published in the Chronicle 
this morning about an unethical local rap "promoter" who leaves in his wake 
destruction and, often, death.

I'm familiar with the guy's modus operandi.  Awhile back I asked an 
Armenian friend if I might rent his Church's hall in SF for a party.  I was 
told that had it not been for Cockerham I would have had a chance at the 
rental.  But there was gun play and a shooting when he threw a "thong 
party" there, and 2,000 people showed up for a venue that holds 500.

Dude's bad news for the legit, quality hip hop and rap community and makes 
obtaining venues more difficult for us all.

Love,

Apollo

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
