Thursday, February 12, 2004 ** Gene Farris @ The Lotus Lounge **

Gene Farris | BIO

Gene Farris is the sinister minister of dance music=B9s changing sounds. Fa=
rris=B9s global DJ track record and extensive discography of over forty pro=
ductions are definitely a testament to the true Chicago house sound. Farris=
's unique dexterous DJ style that includes extended sultry, melodic blends =
with tuff beats makes him a party favorite around the world. House music is=
 Farris's undoubted passion that also drives his full flavored, colorful st=
udio creations. Farris's deep roots in house music and strive to be the bes=
t keeps him on the global electronic music industry's cutting edge.


Pushed by local kids in his South Side neighborhood of Chicago Gene Farris =
caught the DJ bug at the tender age of twelve. Inspired by the likes of Ron=
 Hardy, Prince, and Roy Ayers Farris began blending a mixture of funk, disc=
o, and soul combined with eighties' pop icons such as, Duran Duran. One may=
 still hear hints of disco in his style.


Even in his early years Farris was constantly on the move. By making mix ta=
pes for his neighborhood buddies and selling them at many famed Windy City =
record stores like Gramaphone, Farris's spinning skills quickly developed. =
Not only did Farris's style evolve, his reputation rapidly grew. After many=
 late nights 'beatn' down neighborhood block parties, Farris earned his chi=
ldhood dream slot warming up for legendary Ron Hardy and Ron Carrol at the =
epic AKA Club.


As the early nineties approached, Gene Farris became a major player in the =
thriving Chicago dance scene. Wanting to hear more diverse house music Farr=
is inevitably began to produce his own tracks. His first production style w=
as tuff, loopy and tracky House. At the time Cajmere (of Green Velvet) just=
 started a new label named, Relief Records. Close friend, Ron Trent, urged =
Farris take his hard hitting tunes to Relief Records. Trent thought Farris'=
s tracky sound was perfect for the early Relief.


House music history was made when Farris took his demo to Relief Records. H=
anging out in the Relief office was another young Chicago DJ called Sneak, =
who also just made his first demo. Farris and Sneak both had their tracks s=
igned. The "Farris Wheel" EP was Farris=B9s debut release for Relief in 199=
4. Gene Farris, alongside like minded musicians such as DJ Sneak, Paul John=
son, Derrick Carter, DJ Rush, Ron Trent, Boo Williams and Glen Underground =
formed the new wave of notorious, soon to be globe trotting Chicago DJs and=
 producers.


The "Farris Wheel" EP was the beginning of a prolific production career. Ge=
ne Farris=B9s discography highlights works released on dance music=B9s most=
 respected labels such as, Defected/Fluential, Soma Records, Siesta Music, =
Force Inc., Formaldehyde, 83 West/ Camouflage, Communique, Defmix, Static, =
and more.


Being a leader in the industry, Gene Farris started his own label, Farris W=
heel Recordings, Inc. in 1998, with "The Copa Cabana" EP. Among the label=
=B9s many loved EPs is FWR 008 "The Spirit" - Gene Farris featuring Sneak r=
emix. In February of 2001, Gene Farris unveiled Farris Wheel Recordings's s=
pin-off, Farris Wheel Limited. Farris's concept for the new imprint is to s=
teer away from saturated samples and feature more original, organic product=
ions. Farris Wheel Limited artists are incorporating live feeds into their =
melodic soulful beats. Also, 2003 will see the release of the Farris Wheel =
imprint's first CD compilation of the its own catalouge mixed by Gene Farri=
s.


Currently, Farris continues his travels around the globe DJing for his fans=
 throughout the United States, Canada, and many European countries like Cro=
atia, Holland, Israel, and Russia. However, Farris still finds time in his =
busy schedule to devote in the studio. He is is working on a full length al=
bum of original music for release in 2003. Farris's motive for the album is=
 to push beyond the barriers of the current house music sound. Farris alrea=
dy collaborated with many remarkable dance musicians such as renowned house=
 vocalist, Robert Owens and a fresh New York City production favorite, Onio=
nz (just to name a few).
When asked about his future in music Gene Farris passionately replies, "Hou=
se music is my one and only true love. I've been with her for over sixteen =
years and never plan on leaving. She's my peace... me and the music."


As the critics continually applaud his greatening accomplishments, Gene Far=
ris and his Farris Wheel Recordings empire continue to thrive.


The international demand for the elite Chicago House sound has kept Gene Fa=
rris busy gigging around the globe for over the past ten years. Then Februa=
ry 2003 saw the release of Gene's "Textures" mix CD and 6-track vinyl, acco=
mpanied by his "Textures" world tour, and features and reviews in Jockey Sl=
ut, Muzik, Mixmag, Seven Update, Mojo, DJ, IDJ, Blues & Soul, Echo, Muzik.c=
om, Xpander.nl, Burn It Blue, Worlddj.com and many more.


"Textures is a tasty affair, lots of layers, lots of passion, lots of origi=
nality. Deep, sexy, organic house music with that essential Chicago touch. =
A collection to inspire...5/5" DJ Mag
"The first collection from respected Chicago producer Gene Farris' Farris W=
heel Ltd...As good a house mix as you are gonna hear this month...4/5" IDJ =
Mag
"It's deep jazzy, stylish, sexy and soulful, showcasing fast rising talents=
 in the Farris Wheel Family such as Roomsa, Audiowhores, Greenkeepers, Behi=
nd the Groove and Boo Williams. It's damn fine house, nothing too heavy, ju=
st good party tunes from funk to disco and jazz to soul, it's all here as G=
ene graces us with some proper musical music." www.4clubbers.net

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1076
Sacramento California, USA

d to impress with either theme in mind.
=A0

 spoken word, costumes, food (BYOB) and more.
=A0
You are not just spectator, but participant, so come and add your own eleme=
nt to the party. We're reclaiming the streets together, what you do with th=
em is up to you!

Reclaim The Streets!

=A0 =A0

Posts: 3

Re: Reclaim The Streets Party (FREE)
=AB Reply #1 on: Today at 3:27pm =BB=09 Quote  Modify  Remove
------------------------------------------------------------------------
This Reclaim The Streets event is being used in part to help bring together=
 the SF "activist" community, with the underground artist/performer communi=
ty, and the late night dance/music communities. =A0We all experience first =
hand the increasing intrusiveness of state repression. =A0Art, performance,=
 music, dance, these are the things that celebrate life and should be held =
up and revered in our society. Instead however, it is these very things tha=
t are constantly trying to be squashed. =A0If you want to have an art exhib=
ition, a performance, a concert, or a party, you have to jump through all s=
orts of bureaucratic hoops, pay for all sorts of permits, and then IF they =
approve of things, you are allowed to have your event. What happens if you =
don't have the means to meet all of their ridiculous standards? What if you=
 don't have the money to pay for all of their permits? Your options include=
 not having the event at all, or having it anyway illegally. And so we have=
 these unpermitted events. Often. And almost as often we have them shut dow=
n by the police. Or they just come in and harass people. For what? For enjo=
ying life? For celebrating that which makes us human? But we're experiencin=
g it more and more. And now they have the RAVE act at their disposal too. A=
nd it is going to continue to get worse until we rise up and say "Enough!"
=A0
So that is part of what we're doing with this RTS. Showing that if you
won't let us have our events in our own spaces where we aren't bothering an=
yone, than we are going to take it to the streets and have our events there=
!
=A0
For more info about RTS itself, you should go straight to the source. These=
 two links are from the London RTS group which began RTS originally way bac=
k in the day. They're a bit long, but very worth reading.
http://rts.gn.apc.org/evol.htm
and
http://rts.gn.apc.org/prop01.htm
=A0
See You There!
http://www.rts-sf.org (still working on this)
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1078
San Francisco California, USA

Saturday, February 21, 2004 ** ***Mirage*** presented by Illumination Recor=
ds, Hardscience, and friends **

As many of you may know already, Mirage first appeared as a Wednesday club =
night here in San Jose. Unfortunately, as with many nightclubs in the scene=
, the venue was sold and new owners came in to change the club into a blues=
-rock bar. Mirage with its family and friends enjoyed a fun 2003 run and th=
e night vanished just before winter. Recently, we were told that Mirage wil=
l once again take shape in February. All who were involved with Mirage will=
 return to help recreate the magic and build a safe-haven for its reappeara=
nce. As the prophets give us more information, we will forward the details =
to you. Returning to the source of power are Mirage resident DJs: Michael L=
iu (Illumination Records), Denise (Sound Asylum), Dragn'fly (Shaolin), Maje=
re (Elektrosorcery), and Proteus (Vibe Rite). Crisp clean concert sound pow=
ered by Logik Pro. Much more information to follow on this all ages event..=
=2E If you wish to help direct your positive energies to the rematerializat=
ion of Mirage, please get in touch.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] RE: Bullshit!!! (Dj's vs. RIAA)

i don't think any indy dance label is going to sue anyone other than some 
fool dj that decides to press up pro cd's with the glass master and selling 
it for 12$ each. on the other hand, it's too much for the label to loose not 
to have the local dj's playing their records and putting them on mix's for 
handing out to punters and promoters.
labels know this and allow it just since it will drive sales further. it's 
really that simple.
also, the RIAA is not interested in small labels. there is no money there. 
they are on all the large mainstream labels jocks; and that includes the so 
called 'UG dance labels' that are off shoots from sony, virgin, capitol, 
ect....
as far as dj's go about they're mix cd's it's just a matter of putting 
decent liner notes on either the webpage that the mp3 resides on, or the 
graphics for the cd shell. the label, the artist and song title is more than 
enough to make any UG label happy! now im all for lawyers if i see the track 
on some professional cd thats at ameoba selling for 12$ even if it's a local 
dj. sorry, but it takes money to put out vinyl and copyrights mean just 
that.....

hak

>I'm just wondering WTF these labels/producers were thinking when they put 
>their tracks out on vinyl, in the first place, if they're going to get all 
>lawsuit-happy over DJs mixing and playing them.  It seems pretty obvious to 
>me....
>
>I mean...  who the hell buys vinyl just to sit at home and listen to it 
>alone and in private on a single record player and no mixer?!?!?  (Though 
>I'm sure SOMEONE will point out that they do so, just to prove me 
>wrong....)  For that, we have CDs and MP3s!
>
>Isn't the whole POINT of vinyl that DJs are going to mix it together, and 
>play it out at a party?  And if they're not getting gigs yet, damn straight 
>they're handing out mix tapes/CDs to anyone who'll take them.  Why the hell 
>ELSE, other than the DJ-and-1200-friendly user interface, WOULD you release 
>your tracks on a low-fi, analog (ugh!), degrades-every-time-you-play-it, 
>ruined by moderate heat, easy to break, more expensive to make than CD, and 
>less space efficent, format like vinyl?!?!?
>
>
>cya,

>as it couldn't fit under a seat or in the overhead. Maybe it depends on the 
>airline...
>
>I dunno, the idea of ever checking my records again is way too scary. I 
>have had too many "incidents" with my stuff going in the cargo holds. I 
>prefer to carry on everything these days...
>
>M-
>

Subject: [sfraves] Fiberglass Coffin (was re: cheap record cases)

Just thought i'd put this out there:

I'm in the process of building myself a ultra-retro-moderne DJ coffin 
out of fiberglass. If anyone's interested in the design/build aspect of 
it, or if maybe you're in the market for a lightweight, super fucking 
cool looking coffin (custom colors!), hit me up off-list. I'll be 
posting photos of my progress as it happens.

all this talk of cheap record cases reminded me of why i started this 
project. i couldn't find a sturdy coffin worthy of being a piece of 
furniture in my living room - i don't dig the cheap black carpet look.

-Philip-

Subject: [sfraves] .: 1/25 Dirtbox Radio | Hooligan | Grimm Reeper | JB Mix :.


Whoops, I forgot to send out the emails...  here 'tis, tonight's Dirtbox
Gameplan.... ->

07-08pm EST - ODJ & Jerel - Yer faithful hosts bang out some ch00ns to
open up the show.  Got a few new dubs for the night as well, from the
likes of Akasha, Evancipaiton, and Eskmo.

08-09:30pm EST - Hooligan - True master of the mix, Hooligan is kind
enough to grace us with his presence once again.  Hooligan rocks a good
mix of tracks, sticking mainly to the dark, trippy side of drum 'n' bass.

09:30-11pm EST - Grimm Reeper - Host of Jungletrain's Dismantled Beats
show, and good friend of the Dirtbox Kru, the Grimm Reeper knows how to
throw down propa!

11-12am EST - ODJ & Jerel, maybe some other cats as well - more
hoodlumness!

12-01am EST - Exclusive B2B mix by JB

01-??am EST - Depends on the weather.  If we're snowed in, it's HARDCORE
TIME!

So yea, tune in goddammit:

128k - http://64.246.60.15:8800/listen.pls
64k - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls

webcam - http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

chat - http://jungletrain.net/index.php?page=2&subpage=0&color=2

Boh!

Jackson aka ODJ

Partners in Crime, www.DirtboxRadio.com, Trividual Productions, ALIAS

Subject: [sfraves] -*BSP Winter Kellys mission rock(sf)  this saturday!!!! jan 31st 2004

Surreal Entertainment and SFBang! productions proudly present!

Winter!
January 31st 2004!!!
Kelly's Mission Rock
817 China Basin
San Francisco, Ca

A mini massive to start the year off with a BANG!! and what better way than 
the joining of 2 crews to mix their magic and make your wildest dreams come 
true. Surreal Entertainment (Known for their yearly Earthdance,Liquid lotus 
festival,Refliections and their Club Further) branching out all the way from 
Arizona to join forces with SF's newest and quickly growing production 
company SFBang!, they brought
you GhettoTechnoSuperCaliExtraBootyLicious and if you attended that you know 
the vibe and you know the rukus and a rocking time to look forward to!

WINTER is going to be SF's First EVER snow party!
dance the night away in the falling snowflakes with 2 brand new artificial 
snow machines! You all are encouraged to wear stylish winter themed 
costumes. The Surreal girls will be there in full effect dressed as sexy 
snow bunnies and snow angels!!! Feel free to join them on the fun!

This party will have somthing for everyone including House, Trance, Breaks, 
Drum and Bass, and some good old fashioned HARDCORE!


Entertainers for the evening:


AK1200 (Planet of the Drums) Orlando FL -Drum and Bass,Jungle-

Jon Bishop (ICU, Tidy Trax) San Diego -HardHouse,Nrg-

Nicholas Bennison (AM recordings,Insomniac,Surreal Entertainment) Los 
Angeles -Tribal,Hard Trance-

DjVanDeBelle (Surreal Entertainment, Knothole prod.) France -Euro,Hard 
Trance- **First California Appearance! and cd release party entitled 'Winter 
2003'**

Dyloot Tom Slick Hayes Joey Mazzola Anthony Mad Lost Boy Reckless Ryan Molly 
Mush vs.Valerie Sparks Jesse Gonzales Dj frequency Justin Hale Felipe Avelar 
Joseph Mykal Dj Rhinox Vs. The Tranceducer Michael Liu Tek-Threat Aaron Jae 
Skebatle Orion Jay Vigor djkidcasper Johnny appleseed Dj 2QT the Doctor Pete 
Nice ShardOn vs. Yagi Rif Seiichi...

And Mc's For the Night!
Mc Ragga Banton and Mc L-Ski from the BoomBastik Crew Meeting Mc Fish and 
Axiom for the First time to rock a Very Special *LIVE* DnB and Hip Hop 
MASHUP!

With MANY more Dj's to be announced...

Winter will be at Kelly's Mission rock 817 China Basin San Francisco, Ca and 
  will feature 4 area's with ear numbing sound and mind blowing video 
screens located throughout the event
this is going to be a night of sensory overload! Be prepared for a night of 
Winter time fun and excitement
but please be aware ** This will be a ZERO tolerance event!**
no drugs or weapons of any sort will be allowed to enter the venue.
For those of you 21+ there will be several Full bars for your drinking 
pleasure and
to play and dance the night away in the snow you must be +18 with proper ID.
Tickets Available ONLINE NOW @ www.WantTickets.com for a early bird price of 
$17.00
untill January.
$20.00 presales untill the day of the event and $25.00 at the door
Winter will have a 2000 person limited capacity so get your spot in the snow 
while you can!
Ticket Outlets:
Skills (Berkeley) 510.704.9876
F-8 (SF) 415.221.4142
Solid Grooves (Santa Clara) 408.248.6399
Hit Factory (San Jose) 16 S. White Rd. 408.929-4487

Info Line: (408) 977-3684 (510) 595-4655 and any additional questions or if 
you'd like to join the Surreal Entertainment and SFBang! street team
please contact @ simplyunderground@hotmail.com or 
SurrealEntertainment@hotmail.com or Please feel free to leave a message on 
the Info Line Voice Mail! See you in the snow!

Mondo Good Times :D <3 U Alida & Adam!

Subject: [sfraves] WR pt2: Saturday night: DJ M3's Birthday party, Green Gorilla
    underground

ok... this waqs a confusing day kinda prior 2 the party... Atomic kept telling me that he was coming over & we aere gonna go out... & I was confussed ;cause I wasn't sure i wanted 2 go out & hmmmm i dunno... i mean... we were talkin' on irc & well... i tried 2 time it just right so that when the i got off the computer & took a shower & stuff... he was gonna be here & we'd jett frm my pad 2 la la la... but i got hella phone calls when i got off the computer (yeah, I'm old school 'cause i'm on modem la la la :P ) so yeah.. when he got here.. he got mad @ me 'cause i wasn';t ready yet... but well... yeah

it was kinda a blind outting 'cause like we didn't know where we were goin' that night... i mean.. he printed something out & i wrote down some phone ###'s of people i knew i shuld call when in SF...

Then we hooked up w/ Delia while in Berk... oh yeah... 2 get in the sprits of the 80's shindig coming up.. i'm well... you'll see... 

oh oh ohoh oh.. so like we wnet 2 Safeway 2 buy a card 4 someone in the Marina then it was like right across the street from BAs 383 &* my bouncer friend was wrking.. Hello 2Day.. oh my goodness man... he told me that he had like hella gossip 2 tell me & i had 2 go back there later 2 find out what the club gossip was...

anywaze.. we end up @ the space where the GG party was & we were early... so the guy who was decorating asked us if we could like help... so we did.. LoL that was fun!!  I hung alota stretchy things & helped hang a big ass fuckin' balloooon...

OK... the party was like mainly house music & all the DJs had their touch on what kinda house music they spun & other stuff they added in their sets... it was fun!

OK... I do have 2 say I LOVED Monty's set soooooo much... i mean.. he promised me he was gonna spin some 2 Step records in his set, but it never happened... also his set got cut short 'cause he spun @ a prime slot of the party & by then.. there was a line outside the door of people that was like more than the people inside & there were like 200 people in the party already...so yeah... 

but his set was Dope!!!  He spun alota break beaty house kinda kinda tracks... I mean.. fuck man.. they were jus hard thmpin 4X4 balls 2 wall house music & I <3ed it!!  I was up in the front Groovin' mostly through his set!!

Other sets I liked were Anthony Garlic... ok... he spun alota Groovy house & added some old school house tracks!!!  i can't remember if it was his set when he played some proggy house, but I Loved it!

Garth spun an amazing set!!!  Oh mY Goodness man... he played alota ummm... well.. good house oh man... Vocal house.. Love it.. then he busted out fuckin' "Eroctic City"  & the crowd went wild!  He also spun a Hall & Oats song.. forgot the name... but it was fun...

Yeah.. it was Dope 'cause there was alota Vocal house that DJs spun that night & I was sooooooo modno diggin' it man! & there was like this early set in the night when the DJ spun some early break beeats & some early 2 Step... welll... it was this DJs set was kinds tribally 2 begin w/ & so yeah... his break beats & 2 Step were also kind tribally sounding... yeah.. Monty even had 2 explain 2 me that the one Dj who was spinning early on also was spinning like  what I thought mighta been some acid jazz... but he said it was like "broken beat kind jazzy house".... LoL

BUt I mean.. i was in total awe man... I was sooooo Lovin' the whole night of music...

But OK... the VIBE was fuckin' Awesome man!!!  I LOVED IT!!!  I mean.. OK... yeah... there were hella clubbers there & some of them were kinda unplurry as fuck! Stupid Drunk shits!  But on the whole, every1 i met were so Groovy!!  I became really good friends w/ this girl Dominique who jus moved here from NYC... she's like this mondo free spirit & man... I totally fell in Love w/ her energy when i saw her dancing 'cause yeah... but yeah... she was Dope!

there's this other dude Chris who I met who was fuckin' Groovy... i mean... there waws this 1 moment when Chris, me, & Brandon were like dancing hella hard in the frint by the speaker (oh yeah... 2 nights in a row me & Brandon got 2 party!) & the energy I was feeeling @ that point... oh man... Chris was dancing hella hard & we jus had like mondo grooy conversation the whole night!

Oh yeah... I lso saw my Angelica!!!  oooooooh... my big sis!!! I haven't seen her in almost a year & we jus totally fell back in Love w/ each other!!!  y'see... Angelica's my Big Sis 'cause she always looked out 4 me & she was like 1 of the people who trained me in SFLNC & yeah.. it was Dope seein' her again... ryck... she misses U!

Oh yeah... I also saw Rocky again & man...it's jus' Awesome I gotta szay this again.. havin' homeboy back in my life again!!

Oh yeah.. & Anti-Tim is my best friend now!!  We chateed alot in the bathroom 'cause whenever i was in there... he was there makin' new friends in the bathroom while i was peeing in the shower... LoL Yeah... it was fun hangin' w/ time that night!!

Yeah man... it was Awesome 'cause well.. a 4th of the party was filled w/ Family!!  Ryan... it was soooo Dope seein' U there =)  I mean... i seriously didn't think that this was gonna be a big party.... but it was... & it was fun hangin' out w/ all U Family out there that night =)

There were also alot people i seen there who i ain't seen in hella long!!  Good Shit man... 

this party was fuckin' Awesome!!!  In all seriousness.. this party totally took me back 2 my old school daze where there's jus' 1 room & the whole room is dancing!!  I Loved it!!  It was totally fun meeting all the new Groovers i met & I LOVED the energy & vibe!!  Fuckin'A man... I'm buggin'! =)

Wow!!!

Take Care,
Peace-> ObY {8O)

input on what types of seminars, panels, and other types of educational =
meetings. We have created an input=20

form on our site for your convenience, and ask that you fill it out so =
that we may custom tailor our event to the=20

industries needs. We could have simply placed seminars according to how =
we see things in the industry, but=20

we would rather make this a community event, and want to know what you =
want to see. You can use the form=20

at http://www.nedmc.com/seminarfdbk.html or simply send us an email at =
info@nedmc.com.

seminar information, hotel and=20

registration discounts, and event information, please visit =
http://www.nedmc.com/contact.html

or hosting an official event, please email=20

info@nedmc.com , or visit our site at http://www.nedmc.com .

Subject: [sfraves] nrr:  pope blesses breakdancers

the pope is a b-boy

http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2004/01/26/1074965471823.html

http://news.scotsman.com/latest.cfm?id=2452304

http://story.news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story&u=/ap/20040126/ap_on_re_eu/vatican_break_dancing_1

Pope John Paul II presided over a performance of break dancers today, who 
leapt, flipped and spun their bodies to a dance beat from a tinny boom box 
in the Vatican.

The 83-year-old pontiff seemed to approve, waving his hand after each dancer 
completed their moves, then applauding for the entire group, from a cultural 
organisation in his homeland of Poland.

"For this creative hard work I bless you from my heart," he said.

During the show, one dancer - part of a Polish group that helps poor and 
marginalised youths - planted his head on the inlaid marble floor of the 
Vatican hall and spun to loud applause from his group and from Vatican 
officials. Another performer flung his body around in a series of spins and 
handstands.

As a young man, John Paul himself performed in the arts, albeit as an actor. 
Watching from a raised throne today, the Pope appeared delighted, as he 
often is by his interactions with the young and with his fellow countrymen.

"Artistic talent is a gift from God and whoever discovers it in himself has 
a certain obligation: to know that he cannot waste this talent, but must 
develop it," John Paul said.

"Be faithful to beauty and be faithful to goodness," he said.

Earlier today, the Pope encountered another group of young people, when 
members of an Italian Catholic youth organisation attended - and 
enthusiastically cheered - his weekly remarks in St Peter's Square. A few 
were invited into his papal apartment, and helped him release doves from his 
window.

The Pope, who suffers numerous ailments but appeared relatively strong 
today, ad-libbed a response to the other kids cheering below his window. "I 
love you all. I love you very much," he called out.

Mime-Version: 1.0

User-Agent: Mutt/1.3.28i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] technic 1200 mk5's . . .

aK <aK@hard-grooves.com> said...
> heya
> 
> it's the 1200 mk5's, the silver ones.
> I guess you're talking about the metallic black 1210 mk5g's (30th
> anniversary editions). . .which are a bit more. . .

DJ Equipment Reviews says the MK5G adds the +-10% <-> +-16% pitch
control. Here's their review of both, from:

(http://www.dj-equipment-reviews.com/technics/technics-1210-mk5.html)

The Intro

Technics have raised the standard once again with the release of
their latest DJ turntables: Technics SL-1210 MK5.

The Good

Technics have kept in all the upgrades that featured on the
SL-1210 MK3 decks including the pitch reset button (so the pitch
fader doesn't click into place at the zero spot), and added in a
few extra nice ones that keeps them top of the pile when it comes
to professional DJ turntables.

The body of the turntable now has its underside made from hard
rubber providing excellent sound isolation. There's also a brake
control feature which allows you adjust how long it takes to
stop a tune with the break button..pretty cool for DJ's who like
to throw a few different effects into their set...beats just
switching the turntable off, at any rate.

In the advanced version the SL-1210 MK5G turntable, Technics
have added a feature that brings them up to speed (literally)
with other DJ turntable manufacturers such as Vestax, who have
been incorporating wider pitch ranges into their turntables.
The MK5G's will let go from +/-8% to +/-16% at the flick off a
switch, giving the DJ greater versatility in the range of tunes
he can play.

The Bad

I think the only criticism would be that they could have
placed the pitch range switch slightly better; I managed to
catch it a couple of times accidentally. That said, its not
long before you get used to these beautiful updates on the
famous Technics turntables.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Sean Casey" <sean@cloudfactory.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, January 26, 2004 11:09 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] technic 1200 mk5's . . .


> aK <aK@hard-grooves.com> said...
> > heya
> >
> > it's the 1200 mk5's, the silver ones.
> > I guess you're talking about the metallic black 1210 mk5g's (30th
> > anniversary editions). . .which are a bit more. . .
>
> DJ Equipment Reviews says the MK5G adds the +-10% <-> +-16% pitch
> control. Here's their review of both, from:
>
> (http://www.dj-equipment-reviews.com/technics/technics-1210-mk5.html)
>
> The Intro
>
> Technics have raised the standard once again with the release of
> their latest DJ turntables: Technics SL-1210 MK5.
>
> The Good
>
> Technics have kept in all the upgrades that featured on the
> SL-1210 MK3 decks including the pitch reset button (so the pitch
> fader doesn't click into place at the zero spot), and added in a
> few extra nice ones that keeps them top of the pile when it comes
> to professional DJ turntables.
>
> The body of the turntable now has its underside made from hard
> rubber providing excellent sound isolation. There's also a brake
> control feature which allows you adjust how long it takes to
> stop a tune with the break button..pretty cool for DJ's who like
> to throw a few different effects into their set...beats just
> switching the turntable off, at any rate.
>
> In the advanced version the SL-1210 MK5G turntable, Technics
> have added a feature that brings them up to speed (literally)
> with other DJ turntable manufacturers such as Vestax, who have
> been incorporating wider pitch ranges into their turntables.
> The MK5G's will let go from +/-8% to +/-16% at the flick off a
> switch, giving the DJ greater versatility in the range of tunes
> he can play.
>
> The Bad
>
> I think the only criticism would be that they could have
> placed the pitch range switch slightly better; I managed to
> catch it a couple of times accidentally. That said, its not
> long before you get used to these beautiful updates on the
> famous Technics turntables.
>
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

>

Received: (qmail 33115 invoked from network); 26 Jan 2004 21:27:55 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [66.185.177.10]
X-Originating-Email: [plurranger@hotmail.com]
X-Sender: plurranger@hotmail.com
From: "Ranger -" <plurranger@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2004 13:27:52 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <Law11-F109ynSGrnXcE0002eb1a@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 26 Jan 2004 21:27:53.0132 (UTC) FILETIME=[41A5F6C0:01C3E453]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Long- Oakenfold at Ruby Sky Friday

I wanted to write something briefly about my adventure since I have never 
heard anything good about an Oakenfold show, except by my girlfriends 
college roommate who saw him spin for her very first party.. which she of 
course flipped over.. and became somewhat etarted ever after..lol.

First, I really like the venue.. except that I almost didn't get in because 
of the "dress code" which is not stated on any of the ticketing information 
or flyers for the party.  That would have really sucked ass if the door girl 
wouldn't have let me in.. but she did and for that.. mad props.  Matter of 
fact.. the people that run the club seem really tight.. they are like low 
key.. you never hardly see them, and they don't mess with ya.. except when 
your girlfriend tries to molest the gogo dancer.. then they tell you to tell 
her.. to stop!  That was pretty funny actually. All in all, they let me use 
my atm card at the bar on tab.. and gave me great service all night long.. 
given there were like 1500 people in there.

We get there at 11:30 and went straight up to the front of the stage.. our 
timing was impeccable because Behrouz had been spinning since 9 and everyone 
was really tired of listening to him (albeit an upbeat set I am sure) so the 
front stage was relatively easy to get to.  We positioned ourselves left 
front stage and in like 10 minutes Oakenfold came on and the place exploded. 
  The gogo dancers where left and right stage.. one was right in front of 
us.. and you have to give props to those girls.. they were hot.  At this 
point everything started to feel ahh soo nice!  And my girlfriend, I 
discovered, can pickup asian girls like flies on honey.. needless to say 
dancing is much more fun when your riding the train :P

About an hour into his set, which started out all very epic and large 
sounding.. you know that housey anthem style he likes to play.. I noticed he 
was changing it up a bit.. He was catching on to the crowd and actually 
mixing at the boards.. he was getting his own records and interacting with 
the crowd.. the beat started to sink, almost heavy and saturated, and he 
made eye contact with me, dancing on my girlie, and her four asian friends 
in the front.. Then he did something amazing, the track was spinning a 
feverish beat, he was mixing in something else, and then shut off the table. 
It wound down on the is really naughty sounding, grinding rhythm that made 
everyone in the place freak straight up, and let out a collective OMG!.  
He laughed, and looked away and kept rocking the place for another hour like 
that.. and I have to say.. sic sic sic.

This was a pivotal set, a time that I wont forget so I guess I have to say 
that Oakenfold is everything live that I expected him to be, and more!  Yet 
he played for only 2 hours.. what was up with that.. I guess leave em 
wanting more.  All in all a good set, but I think I will wait till Ibiza 
this summer before I try to see him again.. he needs to have a big system, 
and big stage, and a big crowd to really go off.. I notice a lot of major 
DJs dont really bring it until they have to.. were the smaller labeled 
locals can rip it up anytime.

Cheers!
Ranger




SFR: Ranger
Santa Cruz
plurranger@hotmail.com
Who knows where the night leads
It's dark and no one can see

Subject: [sfraves] SKRR: Disco Blood Bath found... Finally!

OK.. so 4 the past 2 1/2 years, on the suggestin of Shane, i went out on a book hunt 2 find the book "Disco Blood Bath" w/ no success... that book is like sooo outta print, even used book stores didn't carry it...

So last year i saw something on TV that i totally brain farted until i did research again on the net... there a movie that's gonna be released Staring Seth Green & Maculy Culcan called "Party Monster" based of the book called "Party Monster" renamed after it was rereleased originaly titled "Disco Blood Bath"... HELLO 2DAY... 

so yeah anyway... I got the book last Saturday & I'm already 100 pagews in2 it... it's kinda sad though 'cause I was in the middle of reading "Good Peoples" by Marco Major & i'm reading "Party Monster" by James St James.  Before that I was reading Amnesia Moon by Johnathan Lethem!

Oh yeah... so the Movie is gonna be released on Video & DVD on Feb 10th, but the Documentary of Party Monster  is out already since like last year...

Oh yeah... 1 more thing... Disco Blood Bath was rereleased in 1999 as Party monster... that's why I coudn't find it...

Shane... if you're reaeding this... :::Osby does happy dance::: Dude.. I finally got it!!!  I miss U FooL!

Take Care,

From sfraves-return-109745-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Jan 27 04:33:21 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-109745-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 97986 invoked by uid 1103); 27 Jan 2004 04:33:21 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 97972 invoked from network); 27 Jan 2004 04:33:20 -0000
Message-Id: <6.0.1.1.2.20040126190838.02211bb0@mail.speakeasy.net>
X-Sender: apollo@mail.speakeasy.net
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.0.1.1
Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2004 20:33:24 -0800
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_10009603==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Manni's B-day party 

--=====================_10009603==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

We arrived at Manni's birthday party around 12:30 am.  The party was at a 
relatively small warehouse space on Folsom that has been used off and on 
for underground events for as long as I can remember.  The current owners 
are two cool guys who run a video editing business upstairs.  This space is 
excellent for small, intimate gatherings.  Manni's party was not small or 
intimate.

Since we arrived after midnight we were charged $15.00 a head, which I 
thought was pricey...but, hell, it WAS Manni's birthday.  After we got 
inside and I took one look at the large crowd inside my first reaction was 
to bail.  Almost immediately, however, we were greeted with hugs from a 
number of friends, some going back to the FMR days, so we decided to plunge 
in and deal.

After standing in the refreshments line to score some beers for over twenty 
minutes, an aggressive woman and her entourage plowed past us and battled 
her way to the bar.  Stuff like this really pisses me off and I was ready 
to go off on this woman when she turned around and offered to buy us 
whatever we wanted since she had crashed the line.  OK.  I thought this was 
cool.  A woman not only of decisive action but of heart.  So armed with 
free drinks we sloshed our way through the masses to find a spot to 
dance.  Literally, a spot.  This was one of those deals where you're lucky 
to find a body-sized space where you can move up and down with occasional 
sideways action if your neighbor is friendly.

The crowd was a mixture of the old house music community and 
the..."others."  The old school house folks know how to party, indeed.  But 
having come up through the early days of raving here they practice respect 
on the dance floor.  In a crowded venue this respect and desire for unity 
can make or break the vibe.  The "others" are people with self-interested 
personal agendas who have little regard for those around them.  While a 
respectful dancer will move with grace and a smiling face through a crowd, 
gently touching those he/she wishes to pass, the "others" push and shove, 
displacing dancers so that, often, they can have animated conversations on 
the floor when they could taken this to the back of the room where there is 
no dancing.  Since this was an event at an unpermitted venue I assumed 
there would be few of the "others."  Unfortunately, there were more than I 
would have liked and there was a...clash of values.  The peaceful and 
loving can't win with blatant aggression.  You can, tho, ignore it and 
focus on the music and the good folk.  And that's what I did.  That, and 
many bowls.

I ignored the woman dancing with her back to me and pounding my ribs with 
her elbows.  Break dance circles are a welcome addition on a spacious dance 
floor.   Here it was a Draconian act of selfishness.  Especially since the 
dancers were less than mediocre.  But...I ignored the many times I was 
pushed against the wall, and had my feet smashed, and you know...it 
worked.  I actually had a good time.  Anger management:)

Truthfully, I was swept up by the music.  I haven't heard Garth in 
awhile.  Last time I experienced him was at a Wicked and his set was, IMO, 
undanceable.  Garth has always been something of a wild card.  The guy can 
be brilliant and innovative.  He loves to experiment.  Sometimes it works, 
and then....  But at Manni's b-day he was on!!!   His music has 
evolved.  Genre busting.  Lot of "acid funk," as it were, and one thing 
Wicked always did well was funk.  Deeply moving, and I moved as best I 
could to this psychedelic booty music.

We inched our way, finally, to the DJ booth about halfway through Garth's 
set and stayed there until the party ended.  Jeno closed the evening.  He 
did three sets that night:  first in SF, than out to San Jose, and then 
back for Manni's.  I have much love for this man.  I owe all of the Wicked 
collective enormous respect and gratitude for showing me what is was to 
"rave,"  but Jeno has always been closest to my heart.  Needless to say his 
set was the perfect ending to the evening.

Manni had a good time.  Guy was stoned, dancing, and takin' in the 
love.  And so did I, all things considered.  The old friends and the music 
made it for me and I left at six happy and refreshed....and dripping in sweat.

Love,

Apollo




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the 
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"  
--=====================_10009603==.ALT--

Apollo,
That was an excellent review. Thanks for the update.

I also get quite impatient when I am at a crowded event. (that is, when I
don't have enough room to dance).

You captured the "anger management" aspect quite eloquently.

Patience is indeed a virtue. I'll bring a bowl with me the next time I'm at
a popular party!
I'm sure it will help me move into a mellow, sweaty, groove, hehehe!

Of course, I like to use my long, tall arms and rib right back at those
"pounding rib dancers"! But I haven't tried my aerobic, high leg kicks yet
(for the circle jerks).

Greg VP

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Manni's B-day party

I guess we should have stayed longer. All I know is that the music was not
on spot when we got there at 12:05am. Paying $15 for a UG that had no
decorations and charged for refreshments bothered me. The saving grace was
seeing some friends and talking for a bit. I rarely bother to go out these
days since quality events have seemed to have taken a nosedive into the
ground. Around 1:30 the music got better and then suddenly it went back to
way too deep SF dubby house (think of a Sunset party around 3pm on a Sunday)
for the peak time slots.

I agree that the crowd was mixed. A lot of random club folk that came
pouring in as the bars shut down elsewhere. I think I pretty much stood in
one place the whole night in a daze trying to figure out that party. I like
that space and it has been around for a long time, but it never used to get
packed like that nor with such a club crowd. It would seem that if we had
stayed later and the music did in fact become a bit more *energetic* that
things would have been a lot better. However the 2 hours I stayed were just
*ew*  I'll go back to hibernation again once the 80's Prom Party this
weekend is over. =)

:: r ::

Manni had a good time.  Guy was stoned, dancing, and takin' in the
love.  And so did I, all things considered.  The old friends and the music
made it for me and I left at six happy and refreshed....and dripping in
sweat.

Love,

Apollo




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Beware of being too rational.  In the country of the insane, the
integrated man doesn't become king.  He gets lynched."
-Aldous Huxley, Island

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

-------------------------------1075234879

I'm not a DJ and I don't know any of the specifics, but let me recall 
something that was on SF Raves a few years back. Greg Sandler, a house DJ who used to 
run (own?) the Harmonics record store in Santa Rosa and threw the Harmonics 
parties, suffered a great deal of hearing loss due to years of spinning. He got 
special DJ earplugs that filter out the "bad" frequencies, and I believe 
there was at least one round of surgery, but after taking some time off and having 
something of a comeback, Greg has retired from DJ'ing. I hear he's in real 
estate or some other field that doesn't require working in such a loud 
environment. 

When Greg was posting regularly to SF Raves, he was urging DJs to get the 
special DJ earplugs. I don't have any info at all about where to get them; all I 
can do is pass on his recommendation. 
Greg, if you're reading this, sorry if there's anything I didn't get right, 
and I hope you're doing well. 
Jonnyr

-------------------------------1075234879--

the people that are working the event.

anymore. No really.

Subject: RE: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

I swear by earplugs. I am yet to spend the money on musician's ear plugs
but hear it is the best investment you will ever make. My ear's are
really pretty bad right now and the thought of losing enough hearing
where I could not play music just makes me cringe. I have taken the
steps to protect my ears. I want to be able to hear my son when he
whispers jokes in my ear at inappropriate times. I see more of a
movement going to protect ones ears lately and it make me glad. With
sound systems getting bigger and badder it is almost necessary for
plugs. Oh and as for the women talking to you. When you wear earplugs it
is almost easier to hear which means no thinking they are asking for sex
when they are really saying they need to leave at 6. Peace

Jason

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-AOL-IP: 64.163.65.242
X-Mailer: Unknown (No Version)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

I use the inexpensive foam kind you can buy in bulk packages from 
hardware stores for $2, but normally only wear them when I'm off the 
dancefloor (or when the deejay's playlist isn't worth hearing 
impairment). It means the difference between my hearing recovering by 
the time I wake up the next day versus a dull ringing noise that can 
last a day & a half. No interference with the fine chica interaction 
factor, though their conversations with me tend to not last beyond "Cool 
shirt, where did you get it?" or "Is this the line for the bar?"


fable4our@hotmail.com wrote:

> mind to use em.  I have been in plenty of situations where Im at a 
> venue and the music is blasting...  I say to myself, "My ears will be 
> ringin in the mornin!"  It just seems like an akward thing to get used

Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

-------------------------------1075238219
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi, thanks Chet, yes I believe the earplugs at the site  
http://www.earinc.com/p2-specialty-musician.php are just like the ones Greg Sandler was 
recommending years ago. They're made to fit each individual ear and block a measurable 
amount of sound. 
While the simple foam plugs do protect your hearing somewhat, I think they're 
really for casual users (i.e., ok for ravers, who can move away from the 
speakers) but not suitable for people who are exposed to constant sound at high 
levels (DJs, musicians, and even music teachers!). 
And ... for all you ravers ... please don't spend too much time right in 
front of the speakers! Yeah it feels cool to have the bass thumping through your 
body, but do you really want to be deaf when you get older? Do you want to be 
like Beethoven, able to feel the music he wrote but not to hear it? When I'm 
walking past a speaker, I'll hold my hand up to protect the ear that's closer to 
the speaker. 
Love the music -- and keep loving it!  Preserve your hearing.

-------------------------------1075238219--

Subject: RE: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

i always wear them when i prepare well.  it doesn't my enjoyment of the music whatsoever.

also, this may be just my opinion, but i was at the doc martin event right next to the speakers and i forgot my earplugs.  i experienced no ringing.  the sound never hurt either.
which leads me to believe that quality of sound engineering relates directly to damage.  now, who was the sound company???

anyways, earplugs. use them.  if you plan to live forever like i do, hearing is a cool sense to hang on to.

JOnas

p.s.  i have partial deafness due rock concerts and speaker humping in my youth.  i don't want to lose anymore functionality.

Depends on the venue and the sound system. I've put in earplugs before and
the sound quality drastically dropped, muffling it to the point where
there was no point, if you dig. I usually only wear them if i'm at a club
or a party with a 'OMGWTFD00DBIGFUKINSOUNDSYSTEMOMGOMG' kinda theme going.
Unless there's towers of speakers, there never seems to have been a point
for me...

then again, my hearing's already starting to go.

Subject: RE: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

If the sound is muffled when you wear earplugs it is just allowing you
to hear a shitty sound system. Earplugs block out dangerous sound waves
not all sound. Most sound companies do not know a thing about eqing but
if it is so loud most people cannot tell. Once you pop in earplugs you
hear the true quality of sound. I find dj mixes are much clearer with
plugs in. You hear the records not the distortion of the sound. 

Jason

For just one night, come revel in the marvelous cheese that was the

were too trashed to!  Slip into your craziest 80s garb, or don Prom
clothes- this will also be a  quasi-prom for everybody who was too cool
(or hung over) to go back in the day! ;)  No outfit too garish, no
hairstyle too big, no bottle of champagne too large!  Come be Forever
Young! 

Your dusty wax technicians for the night:

DJ Small Wonder
aka drop (ambient mafia, BZ, SF)

aka naru (SR/Stargaze, LA)

aka redstickman (ambient mafia, epiphany, moksha tribe, SF)

when the Epiphany party was busted.  Tickets are only 5 dollars - you
can buy them:

- At the door

ticket receipt with you for admittance! ****

pogo madly to the beat of a bygone era.  Comon, comon, come get your
flourescents on!  Be smart, kids- respect the venue and its tenants.

Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

	LOL!  Nice one, Jason... Seriously, I don't like to go out without my 
earplugs either. I'll often bring a few extra pairs in case others 
going with me or people I run into may want some. Asking for them at 
the clubs and parties you go to -- and if the people running the space 
don't have them available, talking to them a little bit about the 
dangers of hearing loss -- will also help give the issue of ear 
protection a higher profile in the scene.

Groove on,
						<<< Starchild >>>


On Tuesday, January 27, 2004, at 12:26  PM, Jason wrote:

> I swear by earplugs. I am yet to spend the money on musician's ear 
> plugs
> but hear it is the best investment you will ever make. My ear's are
> really pretty bad right now and the thought of losing enough hearing
> where I could not play music just makes me cringe. I have taken the
> steps to protect my ears. I want to be able to hear my son when he
> whispers jokes in my ear at inappropriate times. I see more of a
> movement going to protect ones ears lately and it make me glad. With
> sound systems getting bigger and badder it is almost necessary for
> plugs. Oh and as for the women talking to you. When you wear earplugs 
> it
> is almost easier to hear which means no thinking they are asking for

> when they are really saying they need to leave at 6. Peace

X-No-Archive: yes
MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Scanned-By: MIMEDefang 2.38
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Voting in the Democratic primaries

Public service announcement: if you are not registered either
"Democratic Party" or "Decline to State" in time to vote on Super
Tuesday, March 2, you will not be able to vote for a 2004 Democratic
presidential nominee.

The California Secretary of State's site does not go out of its way to
advertise this fact. It's explained backhandedly under the obscure
heading, "Decline to State,"
(http://www.ss.ca.gov/elections/elections_decline.htm)
and a little better in the dumbled-down but informative "Easy Voter
Guide,"
(http://easyvoter.org/california/nextelection/2004-primary/index2.html)
which is a joint project of the Secretary of State's office and private
civic organizations.

For the horse's mouth, see the California Elections Code provisions
(http://leginfo.public.ca.gov/cgi-bin/calawquery?codesection=elec&codebody=&hits=20)
in the 2100s and the 13100s. Especially Sections 2151 and 2152 here
(http://leginfo.public.ca.gov/cgi-bin/displaycode?section=elec&group=02001-03000&file=2150-2168).

Registration must be 15 days before the election. See Sec. 2102.
(http://leginfo.public.ca.gov/cgi-bin/displaycode?section=elec&group=02001-03000&file=2100-2124)


Don't forget, "Decline to State" is a valid option.

-- 
What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

- Rush Limbaugh. October 5, 1995 show transcript.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

From sfraves-return-109780-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed Jan 28 18:45:20 2004

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 46830 invoked from network); 28 Jan 2004 18:45:17 -0000
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v612)
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Message-Id: <1BFFDC38-51C2-11D8-B3A3-00050209EDF8@yahoo.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; delsp=yes; format=flowed
To: JonnyR@aol.com,
 sfraves@hyperreal.org,
 chet_swift@yahoo.com,
 djjasonphilips@hotmail.com
From: John B. <SvnLyrBrto@yahoo.com>
Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2004 10:45:14 -0800
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.612)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

 > While the simple foam plugs do protect your hearing somewhat, I think  
they're
 > really for casual users (i.e., ok for ravers, who can move away from  
the
 > speakers) but not suitable for people who are exposed to constant  
sound at high
 > levels (DJs, musicians, and even music teachers!).

Actually the advantage of the "professional" earplugs isn't so much in  
the amount of protection they provide, as the frequencies they  
attenuate.  Those little foam earplugs actually reduce the noise level  
MORE than most of the pro models.  The ones DanceSafe distributes these  
days are rated for 32 dB IIRC, while the ER-20s on that site only  
attenuate 20 dB.  (Remember, the decibels scale is logarithmic.  An  
increase of 10 dB represents a 10x increase in the intensity of the  
sound hitting your ears!.)

The difference is, that the foam earplugs only reduce the intensity of  
some frequencies, mainly the higher ones, leaving the bass to go ahead  
and flow through you.  That's why the music sounds muffled and washed  
out.  This is just fine if you're just the raver at the party.  But if  
the DJ or soundguy is hearing some frequencies more or less than  
others, that can lead to some really fuxored settings and some really  
fuxored sound.  The "pro" earplugs, therefore, aren't designed so much  
for reducing the intensity of sound; but making sure they reduce all  
frequencies as close to equally as they can; so that the DJ/soundguy  
can get some protection, but still hear the music "correctly".

(Though I'm convinced that *I* am so used to having earplugs in at  
pretty much every party that my brain compensates automaticlly; even to  
the el-cheapo foam earplugs.  After the first few minutes of having the  
earplugs in, the music starts to sound "right" again.  And if I take  
them out for something later, it sounds all tinny to me, like the DJ is  
using way too much treble.)

Incidently, the OSHA standard for permissible noise exposure over an  
8-hour workday is 90 dB.  That's equivelent to a household blender at  
three feet.  To contrast, the last time DanceSafe took its sound meter  
to a Skills party (Popsice 4 at the Bill Graham center) the levels in  
the middle of the main room were routinely in the 120-130 dB range.  So  
yeah, I'd say that earplugs are pretty much a necessity.

More information about the decibel scale can be found here:

http://www2.sfu.ca/sonic-studio/handbook/Decibel.html
and here:
http://www.glenbrook.k12.il.us/gbssci/phys/Class/sound/u11l2b.html

The applicable OSHA regulations are here:

http://www.osha.gov/pls/oshaweb/owadisp.show_document? 
p_table=STANDARDS&p_id=9735


cya,
john


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 61775 invoked from network); 28 Jan 2004 19:02:04 -0000
Message-Id: <6.0.1.1.2.20040128110134.0215e2c0@mail.speakeasy.net>
X-Sender: apollo@mail.speakeasy.net
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.0.1.1
Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2004 11:02:13 -0800
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_1874355==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: The 2003 Darwin Award Winners:

--=====================_1874355==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

The 2003 Darwin Award Winners:

1. When his 38-calibre revolver failed to fire at his intended victim
during a hold-up in Long Beach, California, would be robber James Elliot
did something that can only inspire wonder. He peered down the barrel and
tried the trigger again. This time it worked.....

2. The chef at a hotel in Switzerland lost a finger in a meat cutting
machine and, after a little hopping around, submitted a claim to his
insurance company. The company suspecting negligence, sent out one of its
men to have a look for himself. He tried the machine and also lost a
finger. The chef's claim was approved.

3. A man who shovelled snow for an hour to clear a space for his car
during a blizzard in Chicago returned with his Vehicle to find a woman had
taken the space.
Understandably, he shot her.

4. After stopping for drinks at an illegal bar, a Zimbabwean bus driver
found that the 20 mental patients he was supposed to be transporting from
Harare to Bulawayo had escaped. Not wanting to admit his incompetence, the
driver went to a nearby bus stop and offered everyone waiting there a free
ride. He then delivered the passengers to the mental hospital, telling the
staff that the patients were very excitable and prone to bizarre fantasies.
The deception wasn't discovered for 3 days.

5. An American teenager was in the hospital recovering from serious head
wounds received from an oncoming train. When asked how he received the
injuries, the lad told police that he was simply trying to see how close
he could get his head to a moving train before he was hit.


6. A man walked into a Louisiana Circle-K, put a $20 bill on the counter,
and asked for change. When the clerk opened the cash drawer, the man
pulled a gun and asked for all the cash in the register, which the clerk
promptly provided. The man took the cash from the clerk and fled, leaving
the $20
bill on the counter. The total amount of cash he got from the
drawer...$15. (If someone points a gun at you and gives you money, is a
crime committed?)

7. A thief burst into a Florida bank one day wearing a ski mask and
carrying a gun. Aiming his gun at the guard, the thief yelled, "FREEZE,
MOTHER-STICKERS, THIS IS A F*** UP!" For a moment, everyone was silent.
Then the sniggers started. The security guard completely lost it and
doubled over laughing. It probably saved his life, because he'd been about
to draw his gun. He couldn't have drawn and fired before the thief got
him. The thief ran away and is still at large. In memory of the event, the
banker later put a plaque on the wall engraved with the words:

"Freeze, mother- stickers, this is a F***-up!"

8. Seems an Arkansas guy wanted some beer pretty badly. He decided that
he'd just throw a cinderblock through a liquor store window, grab some
booze, and run. So he lifted the cinderblock and heaved it over his head
at the window.
The cinderblock bounced back and hit the would-be thief on the head,
knocking him unconscious. The liquor store window was made of Plexiglas.
The whole event was caught on videotape.

9. As a female shopper exited a New York convenience store, a man grabbed
her purse and ran. The clerk called 911 immediately, and the woman was
able to give them a detailed description of the snatcher. Within minutes,
the police apprehended the snatcher. They put him in the car and drove
back to the store. The thief was then taken out of the car and told to
stand there for a positive ID. To which he replied, "Yes, officer, that's
her. That's the lady I stole the purse from."

10. The Ann Arbor News crime column reported that a man walked into a
Burger King in Ypsilanti, Michigan, at 5 a.m., flashed a gun, and demanded
cash. The clerk turned him down because he said he couldn't open the cash
register without a food order. When the man ordered onion rings, the clerk
said they weren't available for breakfast. The man, frustrated, walked
away.

A 5-STAR STUPIDITY AWARD WINNER!

11. When a man attempted to siphon gasoline from a motor home parked on a
Seattle street, he got much more than he bargained for.
Police arrived at the scene to find a very sick man curled up next to a
motor home near spilled sewage. A police spokesman said that the man
admitted to trying to steal gasoline and plugged his siphon hose into the
motor home's sewage tank by mistake. The owner of the vehicle declined to
press charges, saying that it was the best laugh he'd ever had.




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the 
merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"  
--=====================_1874355==.ALT--

Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2004 12:15:29 -0800 (PST)
From: Susan Gwartney <sooziqueue@yahoo.com>

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] inside the tomb [a poem - not necessarily rave related]

i still remember the sights,
the smells of earth,
with green grass and sunlight
touching my hair

i learned to spin
my own tomb
to hide away from
the world
so no one could
see the pain
of wings breaking
through my back

and the struggle
of tearing free
from my own construct
to rediscover life,
transformed.

a distant voice
calls "a new dawn,
a new day,
come out and play
with the other
butterflies"

and heart weary
as the fresh air
burns my eyes
i find
that i can fly

-----------------
(happy wednesday)
~sooz

list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 67927 invoked from network); 28 Jan 2004 22:03:16 -0000
Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2004 14:02:52 -0800
From: Tim Hockin <thockin@hockin.org>
To: "John B." <SvnLyrBrto@yahoo.com>
Cc: JonnyR@aol.com, sfraves@hyperreal.org, chet_swift@yahoo.com,
   djjasonphilips@hotmail.com
Message-ID: <20040128220251.GA27266@hockin.org>
References: <1BFFDC38-51C2-11D8-B3A3-00050209EDF8@yahoo.com>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Disposition: inline
In-Reply-To: <1BFFDC38-51C2-11D8-B3A3-00050209EDF8@yahoo.com>
User-Agent: Mutt/1.4.1i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

On Wed, Jan 28, 2004 at 10:45:14AM -0800, John B. wrote:
> attenuate 20 dB.  (Remember, the decibels scale is logarithmic.  An  
> increase of 10 dB represents a 10x increase in the intensity of the  
> sound hitting your ears!.)

This is misinformation.  dB IS logarithmic, but the scale is a factor of 2x
for every 6 dB.

If you attenuate by 6 dB you are reducing the sound by 1/2.  If you attenuate
12 dB, you are reducing the sound by 3/4.

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

You SFRavers from the mid-90's (and hardkore hackers) will remember this
guy....

>------ Forwarded Message From: Ismokedmt@aol.com Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2004
>02:27:09 -0500 (EST) To: 604@party.net Cc: gil@goagil.com,
>tripoutny@yahoogroups.com, kevin@2600.com, northamtrance@yahoogroups.com,
>2600@lists.wi2600.org, bataktrances@hotmail.com Subject: [604] Cap'n Crunch
>passes on to groovier pastures
>
>>From Machinelf, a friend of John's The Crunch Man is legendary in hacker
>circles, he was the first. Imprisoned and at times wildly rich and
>completely broke and homeless and following Spiral Tribe around the country,
>John Draper (his real name) never stayed put. He was here in NYC recently in
>town for business, West Point had flown him in. He went to Astral Projection
>at Tsunami/Club Arc and had an amazing time. He stayed at my house way back
>in the 90s and liked to eat flapjacks from McDonald's and sit on my back
>like he was riding me. An interesting experience to say the least!   There
>is a memorial party for Cap'n Crunch this Friday January 30th 2004 with a
>shrine and Crunch retrospective in Soho at Boom at
>http://www.brainmachines.com/goatrash.html (bring flowers, Flapjacks, warez,
>acid.  We'll dedicate Hallucinogen's "LSD" to him.) Memorial Page
>http://www.brainmachines.com/cap_n_crunch.html
>
>>From rainbow Those of you have been going to Rainbow Gatherings probably
>have had your back adjusted at one time or another by the wonderful
>chiropractor brother Captain Crunch.  Crunch had been very ill yet came home
>to the Michigan Gathering in 2002.  This was his last gathering, but Rainbow
>was in his heart wherever he went.
>
>Crunch passed away last week in Panama. His passing was a great tragedy to
>his wife, Heakyung, who said he was fine the day before. Crunch had
>requested that he be creamated.  Heakyung says she will bring Crunch's ashes
>home one last time to the Gathering this year and would like to hold an
>honoring ceremony for him with his beloved Rainbow Family.  Crunch often
>told her that the folks of the Rainbow were his true brothers and sisters.
>Many of us have wonderful memories of great experiences with this caring
>brother.  Keep Crunch in your hearts.
>
>Send prayers for both Crunch and Heakyung.
>
>NY Rainbow   P.O.  Box 1554     New York, NY 10009  Lightline: 212-560-7111
>http://www.nyrainbow.org nyrainbowfamily@aol.com  ~
>ny.rainbowfamily@verizon.net WE  LOVE  YOU!
>
>------ End of Forwarded Message

Are you sure?  'Cause both links I found say that it's a log10.

I could very well be wrong.  I knew that it was a logarithmic scale, 
but wasn't 100% sure that it was log10.  That's why I googled for it, 
and posted those links; both of which say it's log10.  Usually if two 
or more links from the front page of a google search agree with my 
recollection, I assume I remembered right.

It doesn't really matter though.  Either way, there's no getting around 
the fact that the sound levels at most parties are well above safety 
standards.

On Jan 28, 2004, at 2:02 PM, Tim Hockin wrote:

> On Wed, Jan 28, 2004 at 10:45:14AM -0800, John B. wrote:
>> attenuate 20 dB.  (Remember, the decibels scale is logarithmic.  An
>> increase of 10 dB represents a 10x increase in the intensity of the
>> sound hitting your ears!.)
>
> This is misinformation.  dB IS logarithmic, but the scale is a factor 
> of 2x
> for every 6 dB.
>
> If you attenuate by 6 dB you are reducing the sound by 1/2.  If you 
> attenuate
> 12 dB, you are reducing the sound by 3/4.
>

Subject: [sfraves] ~<bsp>~ Winter Kellys mission rock(sf)  this saturday!!!! jan 31st 2004

Surreal Entertainment and SFBang! productions proudly present!

Winter!
January 31st 2004!!!
Kelly's Mission Rock
817 China Basin
San Francisco, Ca

A mini massive to start the year off with a BANG!! and what better way than
the joining of 2 crews to mix their magic and make your wildest dreams come
true. Surreal Entertainment (Known for their yearly Earthdance,Liquid lotus
festival,Reflections and their Club Further) branching out all the way from
Arizona to join forces with SF's newest and quickly growing production
company SFBang!, they brought
you GhettoTechnoSuperCaliExtraBootyLicious and if you attended that you know
the vibe and you know the rukus and a rocking time to look forward to!

WINTER is going to be SF's First EVER snow party!
dance the night away in the falling snowflakes with 2 brand new artificial
snow machines! You all are encouraged to wear stylish winter themed
costumes. The Surreal girls will be there in full effect dressed as sexy
snow bunnies and snow angels!!! Feel free to join them on the fun!

This party will have somthing for everyone including House, Trance, Breaks,
Drum and Bass, and some good old fashioned HARDCORE!

Angeles -Tribal,Hard Trance-

Trance- **First California Appearance! and cd release party entitled 'Winter
2003'**

And Mc's For the Night!

Axiom for the First time to rock a Very Special *LIVE* DnB and Hip Hop
MASHUP!

With MANY more Dj's to be announced...

Winter will be at Kelly's Mission rock 817 China Basin San Francisco, Ca and
  will feature 4 area's with ear numbing sound and mind blowing video
screens located throughout the event
this is going to be a night of sensory overload! Be prepared for a night of
Winter time fun and excitement
but please be aware ** This will be a ZERO tolerance event!**
no drugs or weapons of any sort will be allowed to enter the venue.
For those of you 21+ there will be several Full bars for your drinking
pleasure and
to play and dance the night away in the snow you must be +18 with proper ID.

$17.00
untill January.

while you can!

Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em?

On Wed, Jan 28, 2004 at 10:41:48PM -0800, John B. wrote:
> Are you sure?  'Cause both links I found say that it's a log10.

log10 does not mean it is a factor of 10.


#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>

int
main(void)
{
	float n = 2.0;
	float m = 6.0;
	printf("factor of %f -> %f dB gain\n", n, 20 * log10(n));
	printf("%f db gain -> factor of %f\n", m, pow(10, m/20));
	return 0;
}

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [hohners] FW: Cap'n Crunch passes on to groovier pastures (fwd)

WOW! so sad :(
i remember crunch from all the early parties. he used to post his travel 
diary to the list back in 95 when he did consulting for firms all over; the 
most memorable was his travels to australia. he wrote a great deal about the 
early jungle scene there on SFR. upon returning he was one of the first 
regulars to attend stareye's and my weekly jungle party 'nuff respect'. he 
was truly knowledgable about the music, and i might add was probably the 
first person in the bay area hardkore into happyhardcore...
he was always in his tye-died purple shirt dancing furiously to all the 
beats thrown at him and the crowd at just about every party i ever spun 
at/attended. he had more energy than people half his age.
not the least, he was truly a nice person once you broke through and started 
to talk to him. i will miss him as much as anyone else; and mourn the loss 
of one of the first bay area junglists....

hak

http://www.easeuprecordings.com
http://www.easeuprecordings.com/dubzmix/mix.html
http://www.easeuprecordings.com/djmix/djmix.html




>You SFRavers from the mid-90's (and hardkore hackers) will remember this
>guy....
>

> >From Machinelf, a friend of John's The Crunch Man is legendary in hacker
> >circles, he was the first. Imprisoned and at times wildly rich and
> >completely broke and homeless and following Spiral Tribe around the 
>country,
> >John Draper (his real name) never stayed put. He was here in NYC recently 
>in
> >town for business, West Point had flown him in. He went to Astral 
>Projection
> >at Tsunami/Club Arc and had an amazing time. He stayed at my house way 
>back
> >in the 90s and liked to eat flapjacks from McDonald's and sit on my back
> >like he was riding me. An interesting experience to say the least!   
>There
> >is a memorial party for Cap'n Crunch this Friday January 30th 2004 with a
> >shrine and Crunch retrospective in Soho at Boom at
> >http://www.brainmachines.com/goatrash.html (bring flowers, Flapjacks, 
>warez,
> >acid.  We'll dedicate Hallucinogen's "LSD" to him.) Memorial Page
> >http://www.brainmachines.com/cap_n_crunch.html
> >
> >From rainbow Those of you have been going to Rainbow Gatherings probably
> >have had your back adjusted at one time or another by the wonderful
> >chiropractor brother Captain Crunch.  Crunch had been very ill yet came 
>home
> >to the Michigan Gathering in 2002.  This was his last gathering, but 
>Rainbow
> >was in his heart wherever he went.
> >
> >Crunch passed away last week in Panama. His passing was a great tragedy 
>to
> >his wife, Heakyung, who said he was fine the day before. Crunch had
> >requested that he be creamated.  Heakyung says she will bring Crunch's 
>ashes
> >home one last time to the Gathering this year and would like to hold an
> >honoring ceremony for him with his beloved Rainbow Family.  Crunch often
> >told her that the folks of the Rainbow were his true brothers and 
>sisters.
> >Many of us have wonderful memories of great experiences with this caring
> >brother.  Keep Crunch in your hearts.
> >
> >Send prayers for both Crunch and Heakyung.
> >

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Osteen on An Epiphany Of Sound today (9a-11a)

Hola,
Today I'll be presenting DJ/Producer Osteen on An Epiphany Of Sound
between 9a and 11a.  He sits in the Progressive Trance lot, so expect a
perfect beginning to your day.  Also, since he's produced a fair number
of tracks also, he promises to mix in these originals along with the
set.

Do listen in.  The usual ticket giveaways are in store too.  90.1 FM in
the bay area, and online at http://kzsulive.stanford.edu

Peace, out.

-- 
What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

- Rush Limbaugh. October 5, 1995 show transcript.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: SRR: Online Vinyl Buying aka Foaming at the Mouth

------=_NextPart_000_001F_01C3E655.03901A10
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

.needing to vent.

Is anyone else completely sick of online record stores? I place an =
order, 7 days later it hasn't shipped yet and they still can only fill =
half the order. Not to mention the 2 weeks it takes to ship by horse and =
buggy. Nobody can keep shit in stock, and even if it says in-stock, you =
get an email days later saying it isn't.=20

I always had a good experience with Groovetech (RIP); They were quick =
and never emailed to say something I had ordered wasn't in stock. I =
don't mind a company being out of stock on something's...but be honest =
about it. The worst is thinking you are going to get a tune you have =
been searching for, then only to find out you aren't...what a horrible =
customer experience that is. I can tell you I cringe everytime I order =
from satellite, cause I know only half my order is actually gonna make =
it. But these jokers like satellite, dancrecords.com, [insert other =
wannabe record site here], never have anything except shit people don't =
buy anyways. "Oh really you have advanced promos of someone no one has =
heard about, that the label probably gave you, GREAT!~" [sarcasm]

Even companies like 3Beat, which I am willing to pay the hefty shipping =

scene/economy if someone knows of an outlet I can tap into. I am sick of =

we are all downloading mp3's - CAUSE WE CAN"T GET THE TUNES. No it isn't =
