Subject: Re: [sfraves]Earplugs?  Do you use em? (what did you say !?!?)

:.note: for those non-techs, skip to the plug recomendation towards the end.:.

john,

you're confusing Log10 with Log10(10).  "Log10" is the formal method of writing Log(base10) in
mathematical formulae, which is just an operation, not an equation.  because Log10 is the most
common logarythmic function, most texts use simply "Log" to refer to it, and any other base must be
explicitly stated. only if you see a definite space between the "Log" and the "10" portion, can you
assume that the base is "10."  otherwise, it is the operation Log(base10).  Just as Log(base  e)x is
shorthanded as Ln(x), Log(base10)x is shorthanded as simply Log(x).

Log 10 = Log10(10) = 1

now for your decBels question...

the Bel is defined as the ratio of two power levels A and B:

y = Log(B/A), so to find deciBel, it is 10Log(B/A)

so if earplugs "a" and are 6dB of attenuation, plugs "b" are12dB attenuation,  and "A" and "B" is
the amount of acoustic energy they block (respectively), then to find how much more acoustic energy
is blocked by plugs "b" than plugs "a", we can represented this by the equation:

("b"dB - "a"dB) = 10Log(B/A) => 6/10 = Log(A/B) => B/A = 10^(0.6) = 4

=>> plug "b" blocks 4 times as much accoustical energy as plugs "a".

just as an fyi, if "a" and "b" were 30dB and 33dB, the answer would have been 2, or double the
accoustic power... that is left as an excersize for the reader :P


RECOMENDATION:
and with that out of the way, i can highly recommend the ER-20s.  the attenuation is very good while
not killing all the high frequencies like foam plugs, and they are cheap.  the only problem i've had
with them is that they come in only one size, so if your ear is very small (lke mine), you may
experience some discomfort after many-many hours of use.  otherwise, big thumbsup, and they come in
colors for you candy types who give a sh*t about those things :)

http://www.etymotic.com/musicians/er20morec.html

now if only i could remember to bring them with me !

-=dave

> #include <stdio.h>
> #include <math.h>
>
> int
> main(void)
> {
> float n = 2.0;
> float m = 6.0;
> printf("factor of %f -> %f dB gain\n", n, 20 * log10(n));
> printf("%f db gain -> factor of %f\n", m, pow(10, m/20));
> return 0;
> }

From: "Jack Triumph" <jacktriumph@hotmail.com>

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: SRR: Online Vinyl Buying aka Foaming at the Mouth


.needing to vent.

Is anyone else completely sick of online record stores? I place an order, 7
days later it hasn't shipped yet and they still can only fill half the
order. Not to mention the 2 weeks it takes to ship by horse and buggy.
Nobody can keep shit in stock, and even if it says in-stock, you get an
email days later saying it isn't.

I always had a good experience with Groovetech (RIP); They were quick and
never emailed to say something I had ordered wasn't in stock. I don't mind a
company being out of stock on something's...but be honest about it. The
worst is thinking you are going to get a tune you have been searching for,
then only to find out you aren't...what a horrible customer experience that
is. I can tell you I cringe everytime I order from satellite, cause I know
only half my order is actually gonna make it. But these jokers like
satellite, dancrecords.com, [insert other wannabe record site here], never
have anything except shit people don't buy anyways. "Oh really you have
advanced promos of someone no one has heard about, that the label probably
gave you, GREAT!~" [sarcasm]

Even companies like 3Beat, which I am willing to pay the hefty shipping
charge to get good tunes, are inconsistent.

Are there any 'real' stores in SF that focus on tribal/progressive/breaks?
Believe I would rather support the local scene/economy if someone knows of
an outlet I can tap into. I am sick of ordering online...And you know what
the worst of it is...they wonder why we are all downloading mp3's - CAUSE WE
CAN"T GET THE TUNES. No it isn't right, but, [insert solution here]

[sighs] Thanks for letting me vent SFR. Right now I feel like the weather
outside...muggy.

Subject: Re: [sfraves][nrr] Earplugs?  Do you use em?

On Thu, Jan 29, 2004 at 11:30:52AM -0800, SE/30 wrote:
> tim, i'm assuming your an electrical engineer (or an exhuberant 1st year EE major ? ;) 'cause  your
> equation is for impedances (which has an included "square root of 2" in each since resistance is
> non-reactive)

My information is based on sound pressure level, not power.  SPL more
closely corresponds to what we hear.

And for the record, I'm a software geek. :)

I've been to Dance Records shop before and they're on top of things. A lot
of local dj's used to (some still?) work there and shipping is fast. Jay
Walker was a former employee of the place (reason I was there) and got a lot
of his stuff from work. I count them as a local shop since I could walk to
their place.

Else - Primal in Berkeley (across from skills), BPM in Hayes Valley (SF) are
some good shops too if you want to avoid the Skills store.

we anticipated. A good thing because it's going to make Saturday that =
much more of a blast! However, we're securing admittance to all presale =
ticket holders and whatever is left after that will be at the door with =
no increase in ticket price. We have set capacity at 150 (so you're not =
packed in the place) for this event. On Wednesday we sent out emails =
containing the presale priority information resulting in a surge in =
sales. I highly suggest that if you plan on showing up late (raver.lag) =
that you get a presale. I don't want to have to tell friends that they =
can't get in due to the party being full.

Please tell your friends that plan on going about this! Door policy will =
be strict to protect the venue.

See a lot of you on Saturday! =3DD

this is a continuation of a superior fictional drama:
 
henry was always saying little thought provoking things to his favorite lady friend...that is why she always liked to sack out on his couch while he played with his dog. she never thought about anything past or future with him. she just liked his company. henry looked over at her every now and then hoping for some sort of reaction. hers were always the best, he thought. he also thought that she looked really cute tonight, and while he enjoyed quietly spying on her world, he also liked direct contact, and so he always made a point to see her and say things directly to her that he new she would like to hear, because he was like that.  he was also really excited about things like a cleaner environment, and he thought these kinds of things always started at home. henry thought about a lot of things. :)

Subject: [sfraves] A PLEA TO ALL FRIENDS, PARTY KIDS, AND FELLOW DJs!!!!!!

--0-1485523211-1075444506=:62489
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Whats up everyone!  This is a more personal invitation to come out to Mach1 this weekend.  I'm really working my butt off to throw a great party every weekend for all of you out there to enjoy, but I need your help.  Please...help me, help you.  I have six weeks....thats right, just six weeks to changes this bar owner's prospective about raves, ravers, trance, and techno.  So Come on out and show your support for our scene.  This party is free every Friday night, there's jammin' beats all night long, it's at a totally 
un-COPulated venue, and the best part......IT'S FREE.  So get out here, dance up a storm, and show some love for what every DJ, promoter, producer, and party kid is trying to do.  To all my Frisco folk, I know it's a long way to go to party, but really, it's only 45mins in light traffic.  And to anyone who gets to smashed, come talk to me, I'll find you a place to go "after party" with cool people. You can make some new friends, sober up, and catch a few Zzzzs.  To all my Sacramento party kids and bar hoppers, GET OUT HERE!!! Show us all what the "Rave Capitol of the World" (straight from hyperreal.org) has to experience.  So that's my plea everyone.  Help me, help you have a kick a** Friday night.  Oh...also any Djs out there (SF, Sac, Mod, ect...) if you are intersted in playing out anygiven Friday, shot me an e-mail, I'm always down to give the hook up.  Thanks everyone!!!!!
-Graham
Dj Gram (Synthesound, SF / Mach1, Sac)
synthesoundproductions@yahoo.com 
http://www.freewebs.com/djgram

Man.....everyones getting spoiled...I remember when you didn't know where the party was until the back of the U-HAUL opened. Joking of course.....not about the U-HAUL though.  All the event info is posted on my web site under Mach1, but since you asked:
Location: Brown's Corner Bar&Grill in Woodland (about 15 from Sacramento)
Time slots: 9pm- Dj Eddie Summers
                 10pm- Special Guest (This week: Dj Eep)
                 11:30- Dj Gram
Directions are posted at:  http://www.freewebs.com/djgram  
or, on yahoo maps look up: Intersection of: Main St. / Road 98 Woodland, Ca 95695
 
 I really hope to see a lot of the sfraves listees out there, I've been on the list for a long time and have met quite a few of you, but not as many as I would like to.

From: Karina <karina@hyperreal.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org

SFRaves<-_->http: //www.sfraves.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SRR: Evolution of the DJ Crossfader

http://www.rane.com/note146.html

http://www.rane.com/rosie.jpg

"Rosie" is the first known DJ mixer, circa 1965. Courtesy EMP.

Origination:
"...The DJ mixer crossfader was originally developed as a control for
implementing smooth fades from one program source to another, but where
did the idea come from? Fading between two independent sources was first
accomplished by DJs using two separate controls, often rotary controls.
They would maintain constant acoustic energy (equal loudness) in the room
while carefully fading from one program source to another. Some expertise
was required to accomplish this effect accurately and consistently. It
became obvious that if a way could be found to fade from one source to
another with a single control, the task would be much easier and
repeatable for the less experienced..."

From sfraves-return-109836-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Fri Jan 30 14:26:34 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-109836-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>

Date: Fri, 30 Jan 2004 06:26:33 -0800 (PST)
From: Karina <karina@hyperreal.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Message-ID: <20040130062559.J50640@taz3.hyperreal.org>
SFRaves<-_->http: //www.sfraves.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: US MS: Hallucinogens Could Unlock Mystery Of The Brain 


Media Awareness Project

US MS: Hallucinogens Could Unlock Mystery Of The Brain


URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n1993/a04.html
Newshawk: chip
Pubdate: Fri, 26 Dec 2003
Source: Sun Herald (MS)
Copyright: 2003, The Sun Herald
Contact: letters@sunherald.com
Website: http://www.sunherald.com
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/432
Author: Faye Flam, Knight Ridder Newspapers
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/topics/shamans
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/spirit.htm (Spiritual or Sacramental)

HALLUCINOGENS COULD UNLOCK MYSTERY OF THE BRAIN

Some Debate Practical Uses Of Ancient Practice

Long before Timothy Leary and Ken Kesey and the counterculture generation
discovered hallucinogenic drugs, the Indians of western Mexico were using
peyote to commune with their gods.

Anthropologist Peter T.  Furst, who spent 30 years among the Huichol
people, says that Indian shamans have been using hallucinogenic plants as
a doorway to the divine for thousands of years, likely following a
tradition carried by their ancestors over the Bering Strait.

And now, some U.S.  scientists are exploring how these substances might be
used by doctors to battle anxiety, mental illness and alcoholism.

"These compounds hold tremendous potential for helping us understand how
the brain functions, and they have untapped potential for healing," said
Charles Grob, a psychiatry professor at UCLA Medical School.

Some early studies suggest that LSD can ease the sense of dread that
people feel when they are dying.  "There were some very interesting and
promising results," said Grob.  He recently secured approval from the Food
and Drug Administration to continue this line of inquiry using the milder
drug psilocybin, the active ingredient in hallucinogenic mushrooms.

"We're really on the threshold of a new era of formal and very tightly
controlled sanctioned studies with hallucinogens to study their safety and
efficacy," Grob said.

An ancient practice

In Philadelphia, a new show on peyote-inspired Huichol art opened this
month at the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Anthropology and
Archaeology.  Furst, curator of the exhibition, said these are religious
images, created with the ritual use of the cactus plant.

"There's a difference in nature between people who use this for religion
and those who are part of our counterculture," said Furst, 81.  A
German-born Jew, he moved to England and then the United States in the
1930s.  A vaguely European accent gives him a serious, professorial air.

After writing for Stars and Stripes during World War II, Furst worked as a
journalist for United Press before studying cultural anthropology.  He
made a specialty of studying shamanistic peoples and wrote numerous books,
including "Hallucinogens and Culture."

He maintains that nearly all hunter-gatherer societies practiced
shamanistic religions, which often used hallucinogens or other
mind-altering techniques to see gods, the underworld, the meaning of life.

Though he left the Penn museum a few years ago to live in Santa Fe, Furst
returned this month for the opening of the exhibit, "Mythic Visions," a
display of a Huichol artform known as yarn painting.  In depicting complex
arrays of dancing deer, snakes and other figures, the artist tries to
evoke the visions he experiences with peyote.

Small bands of Huichol travel for 300 miles to a desolate spot deep in the
Chihuahuan desert to hunt for the squat, round peyote cactus.  Furst said
he participated in Huichol peyote hunts and ceremonies and found the plant
extraordinarily unpalatable.

Archaeological finds in Texas show remnants of peyote that date back
around 7,000 years.  Even earlier finds show a hallucinogenic seed
associated with remains of giant mastodons and other Pleistocene animals
that go back at least 10,000 years.

Furst said he believed it was likely the Huichol and other tribes brought
a tradition of hallucinogen use from Siberia before they entered the
Americas more than 15,000 years ago.

'Divine inspiration'

Others see evidence for shamanism in early Europe.  "Shamanism emerged at
least 40,000 years ago and is reflected in Paleolithic rock art," said
Michael Winkelman, an anthropologist from Arizona State University.  "Not
all societies depended on hallucinogenic plants but where they found them,
people built up institutions around these substances," he said.  "They are
seen as a source of divine inspiration."

On Good Friday 1962, some researchers at Harvard gave a small group of
divinity students either psilocybin or a placebo.  Psilocybin, then legal,
works much like peyote.  "Eight of the nine people who got the drug
reported they had had the most profound spiritual experiences of their
lives," Winkelman said.

Hallucinogens act on receptors in the frontal cortex, sometimes called the
executive part of the brain because it's used for higher reasoning, he
said.  They also act on a part of the brain called the thalamus, Nichols
said, which works to help us distinguish what's novel and important.  That
may explain why people on LSD can become mesmerized by a flower or by
their own hand.

Effect on alcoholism

John Halpern, associate director of substance abuse research at Harvard
University and McLean Hospital, is investigating the possibility that
peyote prevents alcoholism in American Indians.

In a study he plans to publish within the next several months, he compared
cognitive and psychological health measures among Indians who were
alcoholics, those who regularly used peyote, and those who used no drugs
or alcohol.

Halpern said he can't reveal his study's results yet, but he will say he
sees no evidence that peyote damages the brain.  "There's no history of it
being addictive, or trafficked or abused," he said.  Peyote can be
dangerous if people use it to get stoned and then do stupid things, he
said, but that's not what happens in religious ceremonies.

Others, such as David Murray of the Office of National Drug Control Policy
in Washington, see more serious risk.  Working among the Navajo, he said,
he found long-term peyote use was "counterproductive to education and
social mobility."

Because the peyote comes from a natural plant, he said, "you're taking in
a powerful chemical stew," with some toxins in addition to the
psychoactive ingredient.  "It is, without question, a risky undertaking."
MAP posted-by: Larry Seguin


--

Subject: [sfraves] infoline, was, Re: [sfraves] A PLEA TO ALL FRIENDS, PARTY KIDS, 

hey Gram,

yeah an infoline is actually key in my opinion.  

first, it is another permanent medium for which to promote your event.  i personally call all infolines just to see what kind of energy, clarity and professionalism the crew or person has.  i remember martin's msgs from the gathering.  i would call over and over to listen to his hyped up messages.  i would get all amped up before the party!

second, who has wireless or onStar yet.  some do, but i would say most don't.   but, most people do have a cell phone or can stop at a pay phone.  i write the directions down to a party on paper, but sometimes i lose the paper on the way there.  at this point i call the infoline.

third, some people don't use the internet.  you don't want to leave them out of the good times you are providing.

i really think your sincereity and enthusiasm is really great.  you are doing a good job.

i am very interested in your event.  i would like to play techno for you one of these fridays.  I have great energy and I can help you make this a wonderful event.

Sincerely,
JOnas

>> come out to Mach1 this weekend.  I'm really working my butt

Hi, here's a link to an interesting AOL-Time Magazine "match guide" that 
surveys you on your views on a number of issues and then tells you which 
candidates are closest to you in viewpoint. It includes all 7 of the remaining 
Democrats as well as GW Bush. 

I think this sort of thing is useful because it encourages people to think 
about the issues and not just go by emotion or be swayed by false logic.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: Evolution of the DJ Crossfader

did dj's actually use crossfaders in the 80's ? In all the old movies they
seemed to use more of a control panel with like pushbuttons. . .

by far the best fader I've ever used, is the infinity fader on my numark
prosm3 mixer. The no-friction design with the adjustable slope is the
quickest, smoothest, easiest adjusting fader that's never degraded in
quality.

takes some getting used to but after that it's just a bad ass f'ken mixer. .
.

: )

aK
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Karina" <karina@hyperreal.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, January 30, 2004 6:23 AM
Subject: [sfraves] SRR: Evolution of the DJ Crossfader


> http://www.rane.com/note146.html
>
> http://www.rane.com/rosie.jpg
>
> "Rosie" is the first known DJ mixer, circa 1965. Courtesy EMP.
>
> Origination:
> "...The DJ mixer crossfader was originally developed as a control for
> implementing smooth fades from one program source to another, but where
> did the idea come from? Fading between two independent sources was first
> accomplished by DJs using two separate controls, often rotary controls.
> They would maintain constant acoustic energy (equal loudness) in the room
> while carefully fading from one program source to another. Some expertise
> was required to accomplish this effect accurately and consistently. It
> became obvious that if a way could be found to fade from one source to
> another with a single control, the task would be much easier and
> repeatable for the less experienced..."
>
> -- 
> **************************************************************
> ******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
> If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
> much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
> & in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
> -- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
> **************************************************************

me... *Fantastic Video Visuals*  8:30pm-4am  $14 door.

Friday, January 30, 2004 ** Tribal Flux by Raw Heaven **

January 30, 2004.  Tribal Flux by Raw Heaven

On January 30, 2004, Raw Heaven brings you our first indoor party, TRIBAL F=
LUX. if you went to any of our free full moon gatherings over the past year=
, you know what we're about.
This winter, we decided to take things indoors. Our goal is to create the s=
ame feeling we all felt dancing under the full moon and the stars. Also, we=
 want to bring you a full season of free outdoor next year on a more bangin=
 sound system. There will be two rooms of music, plus an ambient chill room=
=2E

PSY TRANCE: Mubali, Chromeatone, Random, Zul, Doctah Spook, Witchdoctah, Ni=
kon
HOUSE/BREAKS: ill-D, Christian Intrigue, Hijinx, Mahesh, Demosthenese

Part goes from 9p-5a. Chai tea will also be available.

Ticket will be $10 presale at Skills in Berkeley, F8 and Ceiba in San Franc=
isco.  At the door, tickets will be $15, or $10 with a can of food or other=
 non-perishable item.

Directions will be posted on the day of the event (415) 479-7639

www.rawheaven.org
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D975

Friday, February 6, 2004 ** *Oneiromancy* presented by Oneiromancy **

Doing things different from other crews, admission to this event will be fr=
ee of charge. We are working on the lineup, but as with all our events, we =
want to extend a special invite to all the new DJs who have never played an=
 event. We are setting aside a number of timeslots, in various genres, so i=
f you are dying to get out there to play, email me at wavelength_sf@yahoo.c=
om, with the subject "Oneiromancy" Be sure to include contact info, links t=
o demos (if you have one), and genre. I know everyone plays every genre, bu=
t if you could limit it to one, that would help. I'm going to randomly draw=
 names to play for each genre, so DJs who play a genre that is under-repres=
ented will have a better shot. Its all random: I dont care if we are friend=
s, enemies, whatever. I'll post the list the day after christmas, so thats =
the deadline. Oh yes, and unlike other times, hardcore DJs will definatly g=
et slots at this party. Hope to see you guys there. (look for the full line=
up the day after christmas. ) More info TBA.

Friday, February 6, 2004 ** Raigambre & Slowrider **

Leftlane presents

A special night of Latin Hip Hop Funk & Soul

Performing live:

Raigambre & Slowrider

on the wheels of steel - Mr. E (Dajoin, SF)

in the lounge: (spinning hip hop & r&b)

Frank"Muisc Man" Nitty
& Epik (Verbatum, SF)

Raiagambre || Bio

RAIGAMBRE (rye-g=E3m-bre) - roots, stability, tradition

"Raigambre's Latin-funk fiesta is one of the best musical bets around town.=
" -Chris Macias, Sacramento Bee, Friday, October 10, 2003
This group of talented musicians has been in the Sacramento music scene in =
various forms (Los Gallos, Motivo, etc.) for quite some time now. However, =
since May of 2001 they have come together under the name Raigambre. They bl=
end several different musical genres such as salsa, Afro-Cuban rhythms, fun=
k, and Chicano Groove. Another unique quality of Raigambre is the represent=
ation within the group. Members come from various backgrounds such as Mexic=
an-American, Native-American, and Caucasian.

If someone were to ask what Raigambre's message and purpose is, your averag=
e listener and fan would answer "dancing and a whole lot of energy!" While =
that may be true, Raigambre's songs contain very deep and serious messages.=
 "Caradura" (Hard Face) is a song that describes the expression on the Azte=
c people=92s faces as they fought to keep their land. "Se=F1or Ignacio" (Mr=
=2E Ignacio), a Cumbia-driven song, depicts a tale of a migrant farm worker=
 who has cancer yet still works hard to feed his family regardless of his i=
llness and low wages.

According to Chris Macias, Sacramento Bee Pop Music Writer, "Raigambre is s=
haking up Sacramento=92s nightspots with its earthy grooves and musical che=
mistry." In addition to being nominated for a SAMMIE (Sacramento Area Music=
 Award) in 2002 and again in 2003 for best Latin music group, Raigambre has=
 appeared on the Tony Tecate Show on KSFM 102.5 and MTV=92s Sorority Life, =
as well as playing in numerous festivals such as Festival De La Familia (Sa=
c.CA), Heritage Fest (Sac.CA), Picnic Day & Earth Day (Davis, CA.) and KSFM=
=92s Cinco De Mayo Fest (Sac.CA).

"Raigambre=92s biggest strength is that the band possesses a clear sense of=
 its own sound; it knows exactly what it should sound like, and that gives =
the music a sense of self-assurance," says Sacramento News & Review=92s Chr=
istian Kiefer. With influences such as WAR, Poncho Sanchez, and their own b=
lend of "Afro-Cuban, Chicano groove", Raigambre brings back to the music sc=
ene the tradition of deep rooted music.

For all the 411 check-out: www.bigfloor.com
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1092
Sacramento California, USA

Fresno area California, USA

Thursday, February 12, 2004 ** Gene Farris @ The Lotus Lounge **

Gene Farris | BIO

Gene Farris is the sinister minister of dance music=B9s changing sounds. Fa=
rris=B9s global DJ track record and extensive discography of over forty pro=
ductions are definitely a testament to the true Chicago house sound. Farris=
's unique dexterous DJ style that includes extended sultry, melodic blends =
with tuff beats makes him a party favorite around the world. House music is=
 Farris's undoubted passion that also drives his full flavored, colorful st=
udio creations. Farris's deep roots in house music and strive to be the bes=
t keeps him on the global electronic music industry's cutting edge.


Pushed by local kids in his South Side neighborhood of Chicago Gene Farris =
caught the DJ bug at the tender age of twelve. Inspired by the likes of Ron=
 Hardy, Prince, and Roy Ayers Farris began blending a mixture of funk, disc=
o, and soul combined with eighties' pop icons such as, Duran Duran. One may=
 still hear hints of disco in his style.


Even in his early years Farris was constantly on the move. By making mix ta=
pes for his neighborhood buddies and selling them at many famed Windy City =
record stores like Gramaphone, Farris's spinning skills quickly developed. =
Not only did Farris's style evolve, his reputation rapidly grew. After many=
 late nights 'beatn' down neighborhood block parties, Farris earned his chi=
ldhood dream slot warming up for legendary Ron Hardy and Ron Carrol at the =
epic AKA Club.


As the early nineties approached, Gene Farris became a major player in the =
thriving Chicago dance scene. Wanting to hear more diverse house music Farr=
is inevitably began to produce his own tracks. His first production style w=
as tuff, loopy and tracky House. At the time Cajmere (of Green Velvet) just=
 started a new label named, Relief Records. Close friend, Ron Trent, urged =
Farris take his hard hitting tunes to Relief Records. Trent thought Farris'=
s tracky sound was perfect for the early Relief.


House music history was made when Farris took his demo to Relief Records. H=
anging out in the Relief office was another young Chicago DJ called Sneak, =
who also just made his first demo. Farris and Sneak both had their tracks s=
igned. The "Farris Wheel" EP was Farris=B9s debut release for Relief in 199=
4. Gene Farris, alongside like minded musicians such as DJ Sneak, Paul John=
son, Derrick Carter, DJ Rush, Ron Trent, Boo Williams and Glen Underground =
formed the new wave of notorious, soon to be globe trotting Chicago DJs and=
 producers.


The "Farris Wheel" EP was the beginning of a prolific production career. Ge=
ne Farris=B9s discography highlights works released on dance music=B9s most=
 respected labels such as, Defected/Fluential, Soma Records, Siesta Music, =
Force Inc., Formaldehyde, 83 West/ Camouflage, Communique, Defmix, Static, =
and more.


Being a leader in the industry, Gene Farris started his own label, Farris W=
heel Recordings, Inc. in 1998, with "The Copa Cabana" EP. Among the label=
=B9s many loved EPs is FWR 008 "The Spirit" - Gene Farris featuring Sneak r=
emix. In February of 2001, Gene Farris unveiled Farris Wheel Recordings's s=
pin-off, Farris Wheel Limited. Farris's concept for the new imprint is to s=
teer away from saturated samples and feature more original, organic product=
ions. Farris Wheel Limited artists are incorporating live feeds into their =
melodic soulful beats. Also, 2003 will see the release of the Farris Wheel =
imprint's first CD compilation of the its own catalouge mixed by Gene Farri=
s.


Currently, Farris continues his travels around the globe DJing for his fans=
 throughout the United States, Canada, and many European countries like Cro=
atia, Holland, Israel, and Russia. However, Farris still finds time in his =
busy schedule to devote in the studio. He is is working on a full length al=
bum of original music for release in 2003. Farris's motive for the album is=
 to push beyond the barriers of the current house music sound. Farris alrea=
dy collaborated with many remarkable dance musicians such as renowned house=
 vocalist, Robert Owens and a fresh New York City production favorite, Onio=
nz (just to name a few).
When asked about his future in music Gene Farris passionately replies, "Hou=
se music is my one and only true love. I've been with her for over sixteen =
years and never plan on leaving. She's my peace... me and the music."


As the critics continually applaud his greatening accomplishments, Gene Far=
ris and his Farris Wheel Recordings empire continue to thrive.


The international demand for the elite Chicago House sound has kept Gene Fa=
rris busy gigging around the globe for over the past ten years. Then Februa=
ry 2003 saw the release of Gene's "Textures" mix CD and 6-track vinyl, acco=
mpanied by his "Textures" world tour, and features and reviews in Jockey Sl=
ut, Muzik, Mixmag, Seven Update, Mojo, DJ, IDJ, Blues & Soul, Echo, Muzik.c=
om, Xpander.nl, Burn It Blue, Worlddj.com and many more.


"Textures is a tasty affair, lots of layers, lots of passion, lots of origi=
nality. Deep, sexy, organic house music with that essential Chicago touch. =
A collection to inspire...5/5" DJ Mag
"The first collection from respected Chicago producer Gene Farris' Farris W=
heel Ltd...As good a house mix as you are gonna hear this month...4/5" IDJ =
Mag
"It's deep jazzy, stylish, sexy and soulful, showcasing fast rising talents=
 in the Farris Wheel Family such as Roomsa, Audiowhores, Greenkeepers, Behi=
nd the Groove and Boo Williams. It's damn fine house, nothing too heavy, ju=
st good party tunes from funk to disco and jazz to soul, it's all here as G=
ene graces us with some proper musical music." www.4clubbers.net

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1076
Sacramento California, USA

Reclaim The Streets!

=A0 =A0

Posts: 3

Re: Reclaim The Streets Party (FREE)
=AB Reply #1 on: Today at 3:27pm =BB=09 Quote  Modify  Remove
------------------------------------------------------------------------
This Reclaim The Streets event is being used in part to help bring together=
 the SF "activist" community, with the underground artist/performer communi=
ty, and the late night dance/music communities. =A0We all experience first =
hand the increasing intrusiveness of state repression. =A0Art, performance,=
 music, dance, these are the things that celebrate life and should be held =
up and revered in our society. Instead however, it is these very things tha=
t are constantly trying to be squashed. =A0If you want to have an art exhib=
ition, a performance, a concert, or a party, you have to jump through all s=
orts of bureaucratic hoops, pay for all sorts of permits, and then IF they =
approve of things, you are allowed to have your event. What happens if you =
don't have the means to meet all of their ridiculous standards? What if you=
 don't have the money to pay for all of their permits? Your options include=
 not having the event at all, or having it anyway illegally. And so we have=
 these unpermitted events. Often. And almost as often we have them shut dow=
n by the police. Or they just come in and harass people. For what? For enjo=
ying life? For celebrating that which makes us human? But we're experiencin=
g it more and more. And now they have the RAVE act at their disposal too. A=
nd it is going to continue to get worse until we rise up and say "Enough!"
=A0
So that is part of what we're doing with this RTS. Showing that if you
won't let us have our events in our own spaces where we aren't bothering an=
yone, than we are going to take it to the streets and have our events there=
!
=A0
For more info about RTS itself, you should go straight to the source. These=
 two links are from the London RTS group which began RTS originally way bac=
k in the day. They're a bit long, but very worth reading.
http://rts.gn.apc.org/evol.htm
and
http://rts.gn.apc.org/prop01.htm
=A0
See You There!
http://www.rts-sf.org (still working on this)
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1078
San Francisco California, USA

Saturday, February 21, 2004 ** ***Mirage*** presented by Illumination Recor=
ds, Hardscience, and friends **

As many of you may know already, Mirage first appeared as a Wednesday club =
night here in San Jose. Unfortunately, as with many nightclubs in the scene=
, the venue was sold and new owners came in to change the club into a blues=
-rock bar. Mirage with its family and friends enjoyed a fun 2003 run and th=
e night vanished just before winter. Recently, we were told that Mirage wil=
l once again take shape in February. All who were involved with Mirage will=
 return to help recreate the magic and build a safe-haven for its reappeara=
nce. As the prophets give us more information, we will forward the details =
to you. Returning to the source of power are Mirage resident DJs: Michael L=
iu (Illumination Records), Denise (Sound Asylum), Dragn'fly (Shaolin), Maje=

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this

X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2615.200
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.00.2615.200
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: It's all an image of heaven (or hell)

------=_NextPart_000_0076_01C3E813.5E72A460
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey to all you party people, this is not about raving, just random =
thoughts on our carnal world.

We have an 80's party tonight. Does anybody remember the song, "Images =
of Heaven" by Peter Godwin, circa 7/80 to 1982. He said that the song =
was about "untouchable Madonnas for medieval knights" or "hello boys =
supermodels for Jack the Lad."

Here's a sample of the lyrics that he wrote:

Somebody filled me with photos of you and there's nothing I can do.
The media made you, there's nothing I can do, cause you don't exist.
Just images of heaven that take me to hell
Images of heaven, or something for sale
oh, images of heaven, images of heaven

A powerful song, indeed. And in the Internet media age, we now have =
sites for quick meetups.

Recently, I signed up for one (for men), posted a profile and a pic, and =
got a few responses. So I tried to create an image of something else, as =
an experiment. I posted my favorite picture of a hot personality from =
long ago.=20

And immediately I was flooded with many responses, which is food for =
thought about what we are seeking in this culture.

Even if it's a trick of the light, we still love to believe in the image =
(in this case, a muscular model with white, smiling teeth). That's why =
we are inundated with sexy subliminal advertisements. Just wait until =
Superbowl Sunday. Or any day, for that matter.=20

I think I will just keep on dancing and try not to think too much about =
this concept! It's a bit disturbing but true. Oh well, enjoy the 80s =
shindig!

Hope they play my song!!!

Greg VP


------=_NextPart_000_0076_01C3E813.5E72A460--

Wow, when i showed up and the bar/club place there where maybe 50 pople the 
vibe was in a weird way.. alot of older people wanting to hear 70's, 80's & 
Hip-Hop mix's but all DJ Gram and my self wanted to dance out to was Trance & 
Drum & Bass... but no one would step foot on the dance floor. 

So i just got to give it up to Gram & Eddie Summers for putting on a kick ass 
show. and also for making the after party in the hotel room worth wild. also 
thanks for everthing you guys did. and for sure next weekend will be raw and 
off the hook with even a better after party more beer more people and i hope 
all or some of the "Dancers or music loving souls on this list will show up and 
give DJ Gram some respect."

Well Gram we got to get to gether befor this weekend and maybe put on a Tag 
Team set? hm... yea... Trance :-)

also i would like to say i had a blast..... and we got to find an event for 
are party coming up and some dj's willing to mix it up at are UG :-)


Tonight i am off to Club Gravity in marysville to watch Zack spin at the club 
tonight... Yea, 

have fun guys and once more FUCKING ROCK ON HERBAL WAS BOMB AND THE CANDY

Subject: [sfraves] nrr: hope it works- fun car stuff

hehe

so for the longest time now I've been dealing with a 99 civic that blew =
it's engine and a 91 chevy puckup that had a tranny that died 2x. . . .

Funny thing, my truck sat around for like 2 yrs, and when I replaced the =
trans there were all these other lil issues I had to deal with. I had it =
rewired to tow a car trailer (which I aquired), then the lights all =
stopped working. I finally replaced all the parts to get the lights =
working and even installed my stereo again. Then it died. I used to romp =
around the lil foo foo hood here and people knew me as the guy you could =
hear coming from a few blocks away. 12-14 spkrs, 4 10's, 1 6x9's, 2 6", =
2 1", and these lil plate speakers powered by the sickest phoeniz gold =
amps I've ever seen. about 2000W total. . .now it's only about 12-1400. =
. .=20

my civic tho, damn I can't wait to drive it.=20
It's a d16y8 sohc vtec 1.6L motor. It "was" stock and is sort of stock =
at the moment.
Since I started shopping ebay for parts to fix it (which btw is the way =
to go to save money). I've rebuilt practically the entire car. Heres a =
lil list of what I've done (i dig talking car stuff to people).

btw, san leandro honda has a cool website with all the part breakdown =
schematics that you can order from and print out for help if you can't =
figure out where what hose or whatever goes where.
btw#2- If you're looking for car parts, one of the funnest places to go =
to is the row of junkyard car lots on Depot Rd. In Hayward. A lil while =
ago they seperated the lots and theres 2 import lots with mostly =
honda/acura, one with mostly vw/volvo, etc. . . and a couple others. =
It's fun to go scavenger hunting for car parts and then haggling with =
the guy to lower the prices. More than likely I'll prolly just buy =
another d16 or b16 motor (they run from like $300-500). And on EBay, =
things like MAP sensors and Knock sensors sell like crazy. . .so if one =
happens to fall in your shoe or something, you shouldn't toss it in the =
garbage.

Motor mods-
  a.. Motor was completely rebuilt. JDM (japanese design manufacturing) =
pistons n rods (which are domed, not flat, and raise compression a =
couple points). all new rings, etc had to be changed.
  b.. Brand new crankshaft (after I had the other one reconditioned like =
3x). I've gone thru 4 sets of motor bearings (which aren't really =
bearings) that didn't fit and every time I torqued things down the motor =
wouldn't turn over whatsoever. . .till the last time when I took the =
numbers off the rods n crank and got bearings sized for those =
specifically.
  c.. I have 3 or 4 stock cams, which I need for smog. One broke apart =
at the gear end, one broke apart at the distributor end when I put the =
dist. on 180degrees off.
  d.. A stage 2 crower cam and skunk2 n obx adj cam gear (i'll prolly =
use the obx). (you should hear the car idle with this in, it sounds like =
a pumped camaro). You need the adj gear cuz the aftermarket crower cam =
required a 4 degree valve timing advance.
  e.. Racing valve springs and billet retainers (which I need for the =
high rev cam)
  f.. Lightened crank pulley.
  g.. Aem power pulley set.
  h.. ACT Prolite Flywheel (8.2lbs vs the stock 2x as heavy flywheel)
  i.. ACT Heavy duty pressure plate and and stage 2 street/strip fiber =
pad)
  j.. Stronger Fuel Delivery with an STR fuel rail
  k.. AEM adj fuel regulator with liquid guage
  l.. Accel High Flow fuel injectors (and 2 sets of the stock ones)
  m.. I just bought a stage 2 port/polished head thats port matched, =
intake/exh. This will be the 3rd head I've picked up, one from the =
junkyard, one from ebay, and the stocker was ported by myself, but the =
aluminum was kinda tore up from tightening/loosening bolts so much.The =
ported one comes with cam, springs etc. . so I'm curious to see what =
kind since the guy didn't mention much about the cam, and I was mainly =
just interested in the ported head.=20
  n.. I cleaned the ports in my intake manifold a lil, had to replace my =
MAP sensor/Knock Sensor/Throttle pos sensor/vtec pressure switch. I =
cleaned up/smoothed out the throttle body assembly and matched it with =
the intake mannie port.
  o.. A gorgeous set of headers by SSAutochrome (an ebay company)
  p.. OBX racing cat
  q.. APEXi N1 Design muffler
  r.. All the exhaust will be connected with 2.5-3" pipe by RPM mufflers =
in hayward
  s.. Engine supported by stronger polyeurethane bushing/mounts
  t.. I "had" a dope lil oil pan from moroso, but even tho everyone told =
me it would fit my car they don't actually make a pan for the D16 motor =
(if someone knows someone who custom makes these let me know)
  u.. JDM JUN Racing obd1 ecu with a skunk2 eprom (which I think might =
be for a B16 motor but it works great still)
  v.. Some new wiring here n there, some custom things like valve cover.
  w.. Single piece obx style chrome cold air intake (I actually made one =
of these to suck in air from the Right bumper vent (which I cut out days =
ago).The one I bought sucks from the same place, but is a smoother one =
piece design.
  x.. Theres one piece I can't find anywhere on any other car like mine =
that's called something like an Air Helper Valve. . .I don't know why I =
have it but I haven't found a d16 motor with the same thing yet. =
Supposedly it senses coolant temp and lets air flow from the crankcase =
into the intake at higher temperatures. I think I can just plug it up. =
??
  y.. I'm waiting for a stock oil pan to come in the mail. They're cast, =
and a piece broke off my old one.=20
  z.. I had to replace the stock oil pump (which is a pretty simple =
contraption). I wish I did this with the first rebuild, because =
aparrently it was the major cause of the first engine issue and i didn't =
realize I needed a new one till I took the engine apart like 4 more =
times (which I've gotten pretty good at). My engine initially seized cuz =
oil wasn't making it all the way to cyl#4 (the farthest one), or up to =
the camshaft area.  So pretty much everything seized after a lil while =
of driving with an engine knock I couldn't find till I seized the motor. =
I could just imagine how much a dealer would charge to fix it.
  aa.. Putting everything to the ground is the shifting upgrades I made =
(simple but they make hell of a difference). =20
  ab.. Polyeurethane shifter bushings.
  ac.. Skunk2 Weighted short shifter and shift knob
Chassis/Body/Suspenion-
  a.. Tokico struts on all 4 corners
  b.. Racing Dual Spring Coilovers (which are SOOOO much better than the =
single spring setup, which I also have a set of). The dual springs make =
sure you don't have the slop from the spring to spring cap gap. More =
controlled.
  c.. In the rear I installed a nifty lil camber kit which I bought off =
some dude on ebay for like $8. A great idea actually. . .he put together =
a set of shims (heavy duty washers) and longer bolts, that changed the =
angle of the rear control arms. It works awesome. . .that guy had a good =
idea from selling a couple bolts and some washers on ebay.Adjustable =
too.
  d.. Upper front and rear strut tower braces
  e.. Lower front and rear control arm braces
  f.. The rear control arm brace was removed and I installed a =
Lightspeed Racing rear sway bar. (the stock civic other than the si =
doesn't have one).
Other than those things, I've been repainting my bumbers, I have a =
couple sets of halo projector lights. . .diff guage cluster. . .led =
lights. . .dyed my interior. . .replaced the stock steering wheel. . =
.painted the interior plastic. . .

mmmm. . .
I can't wait till I can actually drive it.
it's gonna be a fun ass car.=20
I actually want to get into racing, like course racing not drag.

so yeah, I just felt like talking. . .

: )

aK
